story:
What is it?

  • We're a Midlands UK independent theatre company. Our lovely  interactive family show ( for 4-10 year olds), 'The Boy Who Bit Picasso', is retouring in a variety of venues all over the UK thanks to demand.
  • The show, based on a true story by Antony Penrose, introduces children to one of the world's most influential and well known artists through the eyes of a young boy.
  • We need your help to pay for the wonderful activity pack and programme called 'The Surreal Times', that we give away after the show.
  • This beautiful document, which parents, carers, children and teachers can all enjoy, helps create a legacy that lasts long after the show, and helps us keep in contact with our audience.

What We Need & What You Get

  • These high quality newspaper style giveaways are designed by Midland artist Gareth Courage. They cost about 20p per copy to print, and are full of information, fun ways of creating more art in the style of Picasso, Roland Penrose, and Lee Miller (The artist's whose stories are told in the show)
  • In return for your help we can offer links on our website, signed copies of the newsprint, tickets to a show
  • If we don't reach our target your money will still help us reach our print costs thanks to our other funding sources.

The Impact

  • We feel really strongly that creativity boosts our society in ways that can't be measured in money and statistics. This beautiful true story is a fantastic way of opening children's eyes to being creative in a fun and accessible way, reminding grown-ups how important it is to stay in touch with that part of ourselves.
  • The show was originally co-produced with Oxford Playhouse in Spring 2015, and toured to schools, arts centres, galleries, village halls and the moon to great acclaim. Ok, it didn't tour to the moon, maybe it just felt like it.

Risks & Challenges

  • Putting a tour together requires a whole heap of planning and a lot of goodwill. It's all a juggling act of pencilling dates, negotiating fees and crossing funding fingers. We're pretty used to this by now, having a combined 40 years of experience in the business. We're always adjusting our plans to fit within our means.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give us a hand financially please spread the word about the show, and come and see it. Do bring a child though and go social media crazy.

story:
Who are we and what do we do?

Alchemy Theatre is comprised entirely of volunteers who put in countless hours of their time with the goal of putting up quality theatre for people in Vancouver. This December, we've chosen to present: Alice In Wonderland. In honour of Lewis Carroll's timeless classic, Alchemy Theatre is bringing this beloved story to life in this visually stunning and family friendly production that combines the best moments and characters from both Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland, Through the Looking-Glass and What Alice Found There.

What We Need 

Although our actors, directors, producers etc. are all volunteers, contributions would help us with the following very important aspects of this production:

-Costumes
-Set Construction and Decoration
-Venue and Rehearsal space Rental
-Marketing (posters, handbills etc)
-Lighting and Sound Design
-Theatrical Rights, Insurance fees etc.

All contributions will help us in creating this visually stunning production.
 

Why help Alchemy?

The story of Alice has been passed down since 1865. In this age of technology, help us to immortalize this important piece of literature by bringing it to life. This Holiday season, help us to create an amazing show that the whole family can remember forever.

If nothing else, help a group of really nice people make art.

Other Ways You Can Help

We're artists. We understand not having extra money laying around. If you can't contribute financially, we can still use your help!

Help us by:

-Sharing our indiegogo page on your social media
-Telling your friends about the show
-Following Alchemy Theatre on Facebook or @alchemythtr on instagram
-Visiting alchemytheatre.ca to keep informed on shows and fundraisers 
 

 

Thank you for your support!

story:
We are Xclaim

Xclaim is Columbus's premier contemporary jazz dance company. As we enter our 9th season, we continue to grow in quality and reach. Every year, we raise the bar in terms of performance and production quality, always presenting top-quality, original work with technical and presentational expertise. Although we continue to draw large audiences, we always strive to make our art as accessible as possible and keep ticket prices as low as possible, covering the direct expense of the production itself. We count on the generous donations of our beloved patrons to provide for technological needs, rehearsal space, marketing, some costuming, and to support our families. 

Fanciful Danciful

This season's premiere performance does not fail to raise the bar once again. In an ambitious collaboration with Iron City Aerial, led by illustrious Xclaim alum and Cirque du Soleil acrobat Kelsey Keller. It is a circus arts infused, grown-up take on the classics of Dr. Seuss. With an intricately intertwined interplay of poetry, dance, aerial and circus arts, Xclaim promises once again to thrill audiences of all ages! 

The Goal

Xclaim has always maintained a strong commitment to strict fiscal responsibility. As a registered 501 (c) (3) organization, we are accountable to the public and the (much less forgiving) IRS. All funds flowing through the organization must be put toward our mission to "Bring Art and Vitality to the Forefront of Popular Culture". With the great responsibility and accountability of this designation, we have the privilege to pursue grants from various organizations. These grants enable us to fulfill our mission, but they come with a condition: Every dollar granted must be matched by private donations or other income, such as ticket sales. This means that your contribution is doubled!

This is what Xclaim pays for:

  • Music composition and rights
  • Dancers’ rehearsal time
  • Costume design and fabrication
  • Photography
  • Marketing
  • Graphic Design
  • Videography
  • Lighting design
  • Sound engineering and design
  • Performer travel expenses
  • Aerial Rigging
  • Props
  • Catering
  • Artistic Direction
  • Technical Direction
  • Stage Management
  • Printing of programs
  • Tech rehearsal rental
  • Travel costs
  • Financial Oversight
  • Legal Counsel
  • Insurance
  • Fundraising

Your Impact

The simple fact is that we can't do this without you, our community. If you have read this far, you already understand the value of art in the community, and its necessity in culture and our economy. It is what we do for a living because we are passionate about providing our community with art of the highest caliber.

With nine seasons, more than four dozen performances and nearly seventy original works under our belt, Xclaim is positioned to become a local household name and expand the benefit it offers. Now is the time to join us and have a front row seat to what is next.

story:
Why we need your help

We want to start a Community Project to take some of our plays to full professional production in a local theatre, and give our work the respect it deserves.  We may not be spring chickens but our writing is fresh, new and different!

We are also mindful of the fact that many older people can no longer get out to enjoy theatre as they used to.  So next March, we’re taking our plays to care homes, residential homes and community centres for a series of rehearsed readings performed by professional actors.

A professional production shows our work is valued and that we still have a contribution to make in the world of performing arts.  Any donation, big or small, will go a long way to help us!

Who supports us already?

We’ve been lucky enough to have support from Living the Drama, a not-for-profit theatre company who will be producing the plays and also from AgeUK Oxfordshire. But now, we need money to make our dreams of a professional production come true.  To produce high quality theatre, we must pay the actors, directors, and stage designer for their work.

How we’ll spend your donations?

100% of all your donations go towards our productions, minus the 5% Indiegogo administration fee.   Everyone in Third Act and Living the Drama is a volunteer.  However, to put on a professional production we need to pay for theatre hire, a sound and lighting technician, professional fees, and so much more.

Our flexible goal is £5,800 with a stretch target (yes please!) of £7,000.  We need this for:

  • Actors, directors and stage designers – we always pay Equity rates
  • Stage design, costumes and props
  • Theatre venue hire
  • Technician, sound and lighting crew
  • Marketing materials

We’ve tried to keep the costs pared down as much as possible but we need your extra help now. Any donation, however small, is really appreciated, and will help us reach our target! 

And the more serious stuff?

We have a lot of fun creating our plays and using our imagination but as Tricia Brant, Community Development Worker with Age UK Oxfordshire said: “A Community Project like this has so many other benefits.  Research commissioned by the Arts Council, found that 76% of older people say the arts and culture are important in helping them avoid depression… projects like this help build community and prevent loneliness and isolation in older age.”

Please help us achieve our playwriting vision!  As George Burns said: “You can’t help getting older – but you don’t have to get old.”  Not with your help we don’t! 

Please share this page with all your family and friends!

story:
Our Story

Help spread Improv Comedy and Theatre across the world:

  • Improv Comedy Mumbai, India's First Improv group has been invited to 2 international Festivals
  • In February ICM will participate in Vancouver BC International Theatre Sports Match as well as Seattle's S.F.I.T Improv Festival. 
  • Vancouver Theatre Sports http://www.vtsl.com/
  • Seattle's SFIT Festival http://www.seattleimprov.com/
  • With your contributions we will be able to ensure that India is represented on an international level of Improv Comedy and Theatre.  
  • All money will go for buying plane tickets and covering Visa expenses. 

We need your support & in return you will receive lots of love and admiration in the form of shout outs, personalised songs and videos, and special VIP passes to all the shows.  

  • We will be paying for 5 tickets costing $1300 per ticket and Visa costs at $100 per application. 
  • Depending on your donation the cooler and more personalised reward you will receive. 
  • If our goal isn't met we won't be able to send the full ensemble. 

The Impact

Comedy is rapidly growing in India but there is still a lot of work to be done for Improv Comedy and Theatre.  

  • Improv promotes listening and communication between cultures. 
  • Spreading Arts and culture across the world
  • This will be ICM's 6th successful festival abroad to represent India. 
  • In a world where communication and harmony is at its worst it is important to invest in something that builds an international community across borders.

We have applied for the Visas in advance, the only thing now holding us back is the money to buy our Flight Tickets

  • We have been working really hard at practicing our skills as improvisors and training consistently to shell out good quality improv theatre. 
  • We have a bunch of trained and professionally working actors as a part of our ensemble who are awaiting your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • It would be a tremendous help if you contribute, but for those who cant, please help us spread the word by sharing our campaign, and help us reach people who are ready to support our cause.
  • To do the same you can use the Indiegogo share tools, and we will be forever be thankful to you.

We have been working really hard at practicing our skills as improvisors and training consistently to shell out good quality improv theatre. 
We have a bunch of trained and professionally working actors as a part of our ensemble who are awaiting your support.


Other Ways You Can Help

It would be a tremendous help if you contribute, but for those who cant, please help us spread the word by sharing our campaign, and help us reach people who are ready to support our cause.
To do the same you can use the Indiegogo share tools, and we will be forever be thankful to you.

story:
Who we are...

Founded in 2015, Atlanta Dance Collective is a group of artists with a similar vision to create engaging contemporary work in the Atlanta dance scene.  Dance Canvas 2015 served as the catalyst for Atlanta Dance Collective through the mutual involvement of Britt Whitmoyer Fishel and Sarah Stokes. "site." choreographed by Britt Fishel, funded through INDIEGOGO and commissioned through Dance Canvas, premiered at the Rialto Center for the Arts and featured Sarah Stokes as one of the dancers. Fishel and Stokes share an interest in creating and performing work and wanted to build a collaborative group of choreographers, dancers, and artists to make dance in the city of Atlanta, thus Atlanta Dance Collective was born. Their 2016 season concert entitled Time + Itinerant was also successfully funded through INDIEGOGO and featured two guest artists Gabriella Dorado (ATL) and Caitlin Dutton (NYC) alongside Fishel and Stokes. 

What we're up to...

Atlanta Dance Collective strives to connect people through dance within the city of Atlanta. We provide opportunities for dance artists to create new work and engage with audiences in Atlanta, in order to build the community of contemporary dance. We are a dance "collective" meaning we are a group of artists who work together to present work of multiple artists and in multiple mediums. 

We are extremely excited to share these new opportunities with you for our next season. This September, ADC has been invited to present  work at Skwirlhaus; we will be performing a new work by Britt Fishel involving both film and live performance. We will also be producing our season performance in Spring of 2017 which will include work from artists within the company, as well as guest artists. Our season concert has been a successful way of bringing artists together in the Atlanta dance community by providing an avenue to present work in the city, and we would like to continue doing so. This summer the company will select a guest emerging choreographer to do a residency with our dancers creating a new piece to make its premier at our spring concert!  And again, ADC will host the annual Opine Dance Film Festival, which had its first successful run this past March at Synchronicity Theatre in Atlanta, featuring both a student and professional adjudicated program! And these are just a few of the upcoming projects...

Want to know more about us? 

Check us out at www.AtlantaDanceCollective.com

What we need and How you can help!

We are asking for $3,000 for this project. This will cover multiple costs for this upcoming season, helping to get these exciting new projects up and running! Your generous donation will go toward:

  • Space rental (performance and rehearsal) deposits and fees
  • Technician Fees
  • Costumes
  • Technical costs for filming and editing
  • Travel costs for out of town projects and festivals
  • Travel, lodging, and fees for selected emerging choreographer
  • Dancer Fees (we pride ourselves on paying our artists for their work)

We understand that not everyone can help us monetarily. There are other ways you can help us get the funding we need to be a great success!

  • Spread the word! Share this page! Email it, post it on social media- get the word out!
  • Support us with your patronage and stay up to date on what we are doing!    Like us on Facebook, or Follow us on Instagram! 

To contact us with questions or comments, send an email to AtlantaDanceCollective@gmail.com


Atlanta Dance Collective is a sponsored project of
Fractured Atlas, a non-­profit arts service organization.
Contributions for the charitable purposes of
Atlanta Dance Collective must be made payable to
“Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution
above the value of the goods and services received by
the donor is tax-deductible to the extent
permitted by law.

story:
Frustrated by the lack of diversity in UK theatre Untold was founded in 2014 by Nadia Nadif, Joel Sams and Lauren Johnson. We produce shows that reflect a wider range of experience and voices, with a focus on working with BAME actors. We are fundraising in order to be able to tour our second project 'The Scar Test', about Yarls Wood Detention Centre.



It is Bedford. 
2016. 
A time you will know but a place you can not.

With unique access through the Yarl's Wood Befrienders, Untold brings you stories from the inside. 

The Scar Test explores life inside immigration detention centres through the eyes of the detainees, the volunteer befrienders that visit them, the mental health nurses and the officers working there, based on verbatim interviews and played out by an ensemble cast using different languages, physical theatre and humour.

The play takes its title from a procedure used to determine whether detainees have undergone torture in their home countries, but not all forms of torture leave scars… 

Last year we managed to raise over £2000 which allowed us to take The Scar Test to The Arcola, London,  South Bank Arts Centre , Bedford and to Colchester Arts Centre.  You can find our 2015 campaign video here https://vimeo.com/127615451


Press & articles about The Scar Test

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-36617900
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/chris-osburn/un...
http://www.ywbefrienders.org/2015/08/07/grateful-thanks-to-untold-theatre/
http://tikichris.com/2015/04/03/catalina-untold...

This year we want to take The Scar Test to regional venues across the UK, performing it in areas where some of the UK's detention centres are located and providing bespoke workshops focusing on the shows subject matter to nearby schools and universities. 

Goals:

1) Raise awareness of the appalling conditions and mistreatment of women at Yarl's Wood Detention Centre

2)  To run workshops raising awareness about the refugee crisis and the current system of immigration detention. We've done workshops for Drama, English, Law & Health and Social Care students at  2 universities, a Sixth Form college and a secondary school.  We want to be able to fund more affordable workshops for schools in the light of their budget reductions.

3) To continue putting BAME actors at the forefront of UK theatre, in this show and future productions.

4) Have more paid internships in directing and stage management for young people not in education, training or employment thus opening up the theatre industry to those of all backgrounds


IN ORDER FOR THIS TO HAPPEN WE NEED YOUR HELP. PLEASE GIVE WHATEVER YOU CAN, HOWEVER SMALL, AND ONCE YOU HAVE DONATED PLEASE SHARE THIS PAGE AS FAR AND WIDE AS POSSIBLE.



REVIEWS

‘This is not a play you walk out of and move on from quickly. This is a play that lingers in the recesses of your mind, nagging at you over the course of several days. And that is what it should do.
Telling a patchwork of stories gathered by YW Befrienders and presented on stage in a breathless 50-minute showing, the production places the focus squarely on people; accents and body language take the place of elaborate staging and costumes. The entire cast delivered fantastic, understated performances.
This is a production with a purpose and a message. And one we must listen to. Let’s hope this was not the last chance for local audiences to see it’

-Sarah Cox, Bedfordshire News


‘I caught yesterday’s premiere of The Scar Test at the Arcola Theatre in Dalston. Not only touched by the performance and glad for the chance to see such compelling live theatre, I am more informed about the plight of refugees seeking safe haven in the UK and more aware of how poorly too many of these individuals are treated.

Cast includes Claire Chate, Taghrid Choucair-Vizoso, Charity Dooshima Or, Waleed Elgadi, John Gregor, Holly Kavanagh, Debbie Korley, Nadia Nadif, Eileen Nicholas, and Arinder Sadhra … and they all do a stunning job presenting a strong case for at least a bit more compassion toward refugees entering this country (many of them the survivors of torture and rape) and ideally a complete overhaul of the system.’

– Review extract from Chris Osburn, Huffington Post


‘The play has a political, social and immediate relevance’

‘Very powerful, very moving but there are a few laughs along the way with some challenging scenes’

‘Really worth seeing by a wider audience’

Review extract from East London Radio



You can find more about Untold Arts at www.untoldarts.co.uk, @untold_arts on Twitter and https://www.facebook.com/theatreuntolduk/ on Facebook
story_txt:
Frustrated by the lack of diversity in UK theatre Untold was founded in 2014 by Nadia Nadif, Joel Sams and Lauren Johnson. We produce shows that reflect a wider range of experience and voices, with a focus on working with BAME actors. We are fundraising in order to be able to tour our second project 'The Scar Test', about Yarls Wood Detention Centre.





It is Bedford. 
2016. 
A time you will know but a place you can not.



With unique access through the Yarl's Wood Befrienders, Untold brings you stories from the inside. 


The Scar Test explores life inside immigration detention centres through the eyes of the detainees, the volunteer befrienders that visit them, the mental health nurses and the officers working there, based on verbatim interviews and played out by an ensemble cast using different languages, physical theatre and humour.
The play takes its title from a procedure used to determine whether detainees have undergone torture in their home countries, but not all forms of torture leave scars… 

Last year we managed to raise over £2000 which allowed us to take The Scar Test to The Arcola, London,  South Bank Arts Centre , Bedford and to Colchester Arts Centre.  You can find our 2015 campaign video here https://vimeo.com/127615451

Press & articles about The Scar Test

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-36617900http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/chris-osburn/un...
http://www.ywbefrienders.org/2015/08/07/grateful-thanks-to-untold-theatre/

http://tikichris.com/2015/04/03/catalina-untold...



This year we want to take The Scar Test to regional venues across the UK, performing it in areas where some of the UK's detention centres are located and providing bespoke workshops focusing on the shows subject matter to nearby schools and universities. 




Goals:
1) Raise awareness of the appalling conditions and mistreatment of women at Yarl's Wood Detention Centre
2)  To run workshops raising awareness about the refugee crisis and the current system of immigration detention. We've done workshops for Drama, English, Law & Health and Social Care students at  2 universities, a Sixth Form college and a secondary school.  We want to be able to fund more affordable workshops for schools in the light of their budget reductions.
3) To continue putting BAME actors at the forefront of UK theatre, in this show and future productions.
4) Have more paid internships in directing and stage management for young people not in education, training or employment thus opening up the theatre industry to those of all backgrounds


IN ORDER FOR THIS TO HAPPEN WE NEED YOUR HELP. PLEASE GIVE WHATEVER YOU CAN, HOWEVER SMALL, AND ONCE YOU HAVE DONATED PLEASE SHARE THIS PAGE AS FAR AND WIDE AS POSSIBLE.

REVIEWS



‘This is not a play you walk out of and move on from quickly. This is a play that lingers in the recesses of your mind, nagging at you over the course of several days. And that is what it should do.Telling a patchwork of stories gathered by YW Befrienders and presented on stage in a breathless 50-minute showing, the production places the focus squarely on people; accents and body language take the place of elaborate staging and costumes. The entire cast delivered fantastic, understated performances.This is a production with a purpose and a message. And one we must listen to. Let’s hope this was not the last chance for local audiences to see it’
-Sarah Cox, Bedfordshire News


‘I caught yesterday’s premiere of The Scar Test at the Arcola Theatre in Dalston. Not only touched by the performance and glad for the chance to see such compelling live theatre, I am more informed about the plight of refugees seeking safe haven in the UK and more aware of how poorly too many of these individuals are treated.
Cast includes Claire Chate, Taghrid Choucair-Vizoso, Charity Dooshima Or, Waleed Elgadi, John Gregor, Holly Kavanagh, Debbie Korley, Nadia Nadif, Eileen Nicholas, and Arinder Sadhra … and they all do a stunning job presenting a strong case for at least a bit more compassion toward refugees entering this country (many of them the survivors of torture and rape) and ideally a complete overhaul of the system.’
– Review extract from Chris Osburn, Huffington Post


‘The play has a political, social and immediate relevance’
‘Very powerful, very moving but there are a few laughs along the way with some challenging scenes’
‘Really worth seeing by a wider audience’
Review extract from East London Radio


You can find more about Untold Arts at www.untoldarts.co.uk, @untold_arts on Twitter and https://www.facebook.com/theatreuntolduk/ on Facebook

story:
What is this Stage Play about?

The Stage Play, “Single Ladies, Wait on Your Boaz! You’re Destined to Meet Your Soulmate” is a Fascinating Love Story about Ruth and Boaz Delivered by a Charismatic Woman of God, First Lady Tamera Thorton at a Single Women’s Conference in Tampa, Florida at the Christian Fellowship Baptist Church. She was an astounding orator who was very skillful when it came to captivating her audience. As she spoke, the Holy Spirit took control, motivating her to deliver the most well-known and legendary message to single women and men of all time.  It made her the most distinguished Christian leader in the world. Her famous message, “Single Ladies, Wait on Your Boaz!” was often imitated but never duplicated.

Synopsis:

First, you have,First Lady Tamera Thorton and her husband,Bishop Travis Thorton, who were the ideal married couple everyone admired. All the single ladies really envy her because she was the First Lady of a mega church with this incredibly handsome man who treated her like a queen. Next, you have,Melanie Tate, a single lady, and a member of the Christian Fellowship Baptist Church in Tampa, Florida, who was considered the modern day, Ruth. She was the most sought out bachelorette by single men at her church as well as visiting churches. Melanie wasn’t fazed by all the attention because her primary focus was being fully committed to pleasing God and helping others. She waited on God, so she married her soulmate. Then you have, Helen Richards and Pearlene Bell, two single ladies who were fully committed to finding a husband. Instead of listening to the word of God, while they were at church, their minds were always on what needed to be done to get a marriage proposal. Their marriages ended in disaster.

These are three intelligent, savvy, gorgeous women who were on different paths to the same destination. Explore the journeys they have taken and the results experienced by making right and wrong choices. Discover the reasons it is best to stay on the path that God desires for you so that you can meet your Boaz. If you are in a severe struggle to find the right man, it is time to put God and the Holy Spirit in the driver’s seat. 

The Cast:

Starring: Oya Thomas as First Lady Tamera Thorton

Lead: Minister Leonard Pegues as Bishop Travis Thorton, Shontel Cosby as Melanie Tate, Braxton Cosby as Minister Antonio Tate, D'Wynter Cold as Helen Richards, Korin Deanna as Pearlene Bell

Supporting: Jasper Faulk as Floyd Bell, Darrel A. Robinson as Stanley Richards, Dave Tolliver as Bishop Johnson, Michelle Shaay as Missionary Johnson, Diane Dixon as Mother Taylor, and Michael Hodge as Deacon Taylor.

The Supporting Cast also include; Nicholas Garner, Ashaki Coutee, Louis Pha’rez Lassiter, Tasha Cash, Rayshard Robinson, Raven Lawrence, Ronald Goon, Cierra Brooks, La’Marc Bishop, and Tiara Hatley.

The Special Guest Lead & Supporting Cast include; Rose “Sasha” Offord, Victaveon Forehand, Telisha Lee, Victoria Wilson, Crystalyn Monet, Lyriq McCreary, Devonte Riley, Tawana Sanders, Tarique Francis, Sierra Lynn, Kyra Waters, Ebony Williams, Shanda Nicole, John D. Blouin, Kingole P. Tshilenge, Chanae Jordan, Mikhaella Norword, and Mister Fitzgerald.

Why This Stage Play Need Your Help?

Our main sponsor for this tour who agreed and signed a contract in 2015, backed out a week ago. This message needs to be heard so we are asking all the devoted Christians, who agree with the positive message this play is advocating to go on this journey with us. Negativity, foolishness, and buffoonery can get major support to publicize their messages very easily, but when it comes to anything that is going to uplift, inspire, and change lives for the better, the support is almost non-existent.

How long will the believers be complacent and sit on the sideline while idiocy, lunacy, greed, and bigotry are in full control? Their destructive messages are being well received by supporters just like them. It’s time that faithful followers of God all stand together and speak with one voice by supporting the much-needed message of this play in a society where everything and anything goes. We can change the narrative because there are more believers than non-believers, so it is imperative that everyone gets behind this amazing stage play 100%.

What will your money pay for? 

Your money will be used for production cost to ensure the 8 Cities Tour is a success and we meet our $50,000 donation goal for disable/sick children with cancer, sickle-cell anemia, and autism. Proceeds from our shows will be donated.

We will be completely transparent and provide a report of what the money was used for and how much our tour raises 60 days after the tour ends. The report will also include how much money was donated and who received it.

Featured Perks:

SLWOYB Friends-$10

SLWOYB Family-$50

SLWOYB Elite Supporters-$500 (You will get to Make a Cameo Appearance in the Play and speak at the Single Women’s Conference for 5 minutes as one of the Perks; Only 2 spots in each city of Atlanta, Columbus, Macon, Birmingham, Memphis, Nashville, Orlando, and Miami for a total of 16 spots)

If you have more questions

Great! You can contact us at info@singleladieswaitonyourboaz.com.You can also find us on Twitter @SLWOYB2016, Instagram @singleladieswaitonyourboaz, and Facebook @ https://www.facebook.com/singleladieswaitonyour... 

We want to personal thank some people without whom none of this would have been possible. Special thanks go to Suzieanna Jennings, John Luke Shumpert, Lyriq LaShay, Alex Zhander, Jerron Johnson, production team, and this amazing cast! 

The Impact

Teens' pregnancies, single mothers, and divorce rate have reached an all-time high in our society, today.  Both single women and men are looking for that perfect mate, but they find it extremely hard to find the right one. Most of them have never heard of the biblical romantic love story of Ruth & Boaz, so they really don't know how to ultimately choose the right person, who God has created just for them. This play will open their eyes to a whole new world of how to date properly and find their real soulmate according to the Word of God.

Risks and challenges

In a disorderly society, where the media and corporate sponsors are not interested in supporting anything positive by a relative no name, so it’s extremely challenging to secure funding. That’s why we are asking our brothers and sisters of the church, who believe in our message whole-heartedly to step in and help us to raise the funds. The biggest risk we face is that the body of Christ will not go on this journey with us as we advocate to young women and men that God's way is best since the biblical love story of Ruth and Boaz is the greatest example to follow.

Other Ways you can help

You may not be able to contribute at this time, but that doesn't mean you can't support us. Please post our link on your social media accounts or email it to your family and friends encouraging them to help. 

  • Ask your family, friends, church members, and social media followers to get the word out.
  • Post and send emails about this campaign every day until it ends.

This kind of support is very much needed if you just can't contribute money. And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Wizard of ODD

Let us take you on a two hour journey to the magical land of "Odd." Witness an interactive theatrical performance filled with dangerous stunts, beautiful dance numbers, and stunning circus acts! 

A collective collaboration between artists from Detroit MI, Philadelphia PA, Chicago IL and Toledo OH.  , this show boasts a true Squidling Bros. experience.

The worst storm in the history of Detroit comes through whisking two young boys off to the magical land of Odd, where everyone becomes who they truly are. Donny transforms into a young woman named Dorothy Gale (Pollyanna High-Gloss) and Tommy transforms into her best friend, Toto the Dog (Bayard Matty). After Dorothy's apartment lands on the Wicked Witch of the East (Matterz Squidling) making her a hero to the people of Munchkin Land (Eric Scott Baker, Flec Mindscape, Aimee Funk and Ring Master Zeb) she is sent on a journey to meet the "Wizard of Odd" (Velvet Crayon), and find her way home.

On the way, the two meet a host of characters including: A Scarecrow (Jelly Boy the Clown),  a Tin Man (Satori Circus) and a very Cowardly Lion (Titano Oddfellow). Their bond of friendship defeats the Wicked Witch of the West (Red Rum) and her army of Flying Monkeys (Sanjula Vamana, Violet and Fortuna) restoring peace to the Land Of Odd.

Your contributions will help us put an all-new, 21st century spin of one of the most resonating and well known stories of the the 20th century.  

What We Need & What You Get

To make the most ground-breaking show ever in the history of Modern Circus/Sideshow performance. We need to raise at least $5,000 to cover the pre-production costs of the event. 

If you contribute today folks, we have some amazing things to offer.  Oh and the perks! Perks on perks on perks! There are so many to choose from: 

VIP themed seating, Merchandise packages, Personalized Cast memorabilia gifts, even a surprise party or private performance by members of the cast!

Advertising -- Flyers, Posters, Facebook boosts and Ads in local papers.

Merchandise -- t shirts, prints of characters, themed candy, decorated lighters, buttons, posters.

Costumes

Videography (to create a live film of the performance) -- hire team of 2 or 3 camera operators.

Studio time for musicians who are creating the all original live score - Zeb, Crayon, Satori

Artist compensation for the original art back grounds -Adriano

travel expenses -- van rental, gas, tolls

theater rentals -- Tangent gallery (AC !!), Collingwood theater 

sound equipment -- lavaliere mics, Stage mics

set materials and props

catering for cast -- rehearsals and days of show

IF we do not reach our goal, all contributions will go into the costs listed above, and force us to cut some corners on cost of materials and advertising. We will then have to use money from ticket sales to cover the rest of the cost of the show - which means less earned by the collective cast of Wizard Of Odd.  

A Story of Transformation

Thematically representing adolescent growth, discovery of the self, and appreciation of where one comes from; The Wizard of Oz, in all of its representations has been deeply ingrained in American culture.  However, from birth we have been told over and over again that there is a certain way to live that is "normal." Often-times our way of life shuns the concepts of 'celebration of the self' and 'self-love' in exchange for false acceptance from society.

The Wizard of Odd is a story about embracing and celebrating the "freak" inside.  Staying true to the fairy-tale quality of the original we are taking a light-hearted and adult-oriented approach to this classic tale. We hope these themes will bring positivity to LGBTQ Rights awareness and show the lighter side of freakshow.

Risks & Challenges

CHALLENGE: Producing the show in Detroit and Toledo as opposed to Philadelphia where the Squidling Bros. are based. This is a collectively produced show based off of performers personal creative process of the characters they will portray.  So the challenge is in coordinating photo-shoots, writing of original score, and re-created dialogue for each character.

RISK: Falling short on funding for proper Advertisement.This is sure to be an amazing experience but without the proper advertising our audience {you} will miss out.  If we are able to afford ads in the paper the show will reach a much wider audience than what could be achieved by DIY advertising.

CHALLENGE: Compensating a cast of over 20 professional artists with what they deserve. The artists will be paid out of Ticket sales entirely. This is why the campaign is so important to cover all pre-production costs.

RISK: A great deal of time and money has been invested in the project. The Risk of not receiving a return on this investment if the campaign is not successful will be detrimental to the financial security of all artists involved. 

CHALLENGE: In doing an iconic show there is an expectation for how things are going to look.  Even with great performers, if the setting and costumes fall short of the audience's approval, the show will be inherently disappointing.

Help us help you to have the best show possible! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute please:

Come to the show and tell all your friends about it!

Get the word out about the campaign and tell people who you think can contribute!

Use the indiegogo share tools and spread the word on Facebook!

July 7,8 The Tangent Gallery/Hastings Ballroom Detroit MI

July 9 Collingwood Theater Toledo, OH

Thank you, thank you, thank you.

story:
Ritual, Revenge, and Revolution in The Maids

In 1933, sisters Léa and Christine Papin were live-in maids in Le Mans, France. On February 2nd, 1933, they violently murdered their employer and her daughter, then carefully cleaned their tools and returned to their bed in the attic. There, they waited calmly until they were discovered and arrested. The case became a sensation in France, capturing the attention of writer Jean Genet.

Inspired by the case of the Papin sisters, but infused with his own unique style and wickedly perverse humor, Genet paints a portrait of two servants trapped in a world in which they have no agency. Claire and Solange escape the monotony of their lives in servitude by regularly acting out a macabre ritual which ends in the murder of their Mistress - or so they intend. Throughout the ritual, identities shift, accusations fly, and tensions rise as the sisters become increasingly paranoid and fearful that their mistress will uncover their true motives.

This is an independent passion project produced by us, Aaron Filyaw and Amanda Mehl, under the name Public Citizen Theatre. Our mission is to present provocative, challenging, and relevant theatrical works to our community. We hope you'll be as excited about this show as we are!


What we need...

Here's where your support will go:

Venue: We received some generous backing for our rental of Shaking The Tree's beautiful space, but we still need $1,090 more to fulfill our obligation.

Cast and crew: We believe artists should be paid for their work, and you can help us fulfill that mission. We are hoping to raise $2,300 to compensate our actors, designers, and stage manager.

Set, costumes, and props: We'd like our set and costumes to be as stunning as the performances. Although the play takes place in a single room, removing the need for multiple sets, it calls for large set pieces and furniture (including a chaise lounge and vanity) which may be expensive to acquire or build. We are hoping to raise up to $1,000 to put toward our vision. Alternately, if you have leads on furniture or set pieces that we can use for little or no cost, please let us know!

Marketing: We'll be taking advantage of free marketing avenues wherever possible, but we also want to promote the show with a fantastic poster and some physical collateral like postcards. To do this, we'll need to hire a graphic designer and spend some money on printing and distribution. We're hoping for around $360 to put toward marketing.

...and what you get!

We hope you're intrigued by our selection of perks. We're so grateful for your support, and we're glad to offer what we can in return. And, keep an eye out during the campaign for surprise perks that we'll be adding as we go!

Why do this, and why help?

For decades, audiences from all around the world have connected to The Maids, and we want to bring Martin Crimp's unique, exciting, and relevant translation to our community for the first time. The human issues Genet explores in The Maids never really go away - they simply take on new faces. America is inhabited by Mistresses and Claires and Solanges - by people whose identities are, in some way or another, bound by the economic, social, or personal circumstances in which they find themselves. 
Inhabiting the same space and time as a performer and watching a story unfold before us has a unique power to inspire us and motivate us to action. We want to tell the story of The Maids because, like all great works of art, it still speaks to us today. We hope our audiences will not only be exhilarated by the production and performances, but will also be challenged to examine their own preconceived notions of identity, privilege, and status. With your support, we can continue the age-old tradition of using art and theatre as a tool for social reflection and change.

Other Things You Can Do

Even if you can't give us money, you can lend us your voice! If you find our show inspiring and want to help, here are some ideas:

  • Follow us on social media! Check out our Facebook page or Twitter feed!
  • Rep us on your social media using the Indiegogo share icons at the top of this page.
  • If you would like to donate your time to help with things like postering, ushering, leads about set pieces, etc., please contact us!

Final Notes:

Public Citizen Theatre has fiscal sponsorship under Fractured Atlas, a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit. Donations made through Fractured Atlas are tax-deductible. If you would prefer to make your donation tax-deductible, visit our Fractured Atlas profile (Fractured Atlas takes a 7% cut of all donations).

story:
I dance to express myself in ways words fail to do. Someone once told me, choreography is writing stories on the body, and that is what I strive to do in my work.

This campaign is secure my attendance at the Baxter Dance Festival Cape Town as part of the main program. For the festival I will be restaging my work After9 for the first time in South Africa, with dancers from Cape Town City Ballet and freelance professionals.
Secondly, it will help cover the cost of my new creation for Afrovibes Festival after being invited to create a new work for the festival featuring dancers from Vuyani Dance Theater (South Africa) and Codarts Rotterdam.
These are wonderful opportunities given to me but will only be possible if the necessary funds is raised. Performing at both these festivals will open multiple doors for me to perform my work in the future at festivals and theaters in South Africa and the Netherlands. It is not only job creation for myself and the dancers involved but also create new opportunities and networks between South Africa and Netherlands
As an aspiring choreographer this tour will be my debut as a choreographer to the big stage and using it as an entrepreneurial venture it will add to my development as a choreographer by creating possibilities for future collaborations between myself and the companies involved. You will be aiding in strengthening bonds and collaborations between the European countries involved and South Africa.

South African transfers can be made to;
Mr. Kirvan F Fortuin
FNB
Smart Account:  62578993282
Branch number: 758

What We Need & What You Get

  • Flight Costs: 
Leg One - Baxter Dance Festival (Rehearsals & Performances) = 870 Euro
Leg Two - Afrovibes Festival (Rehearsals & Performances) = 950 Euro
  • Costumes:  330 Euro
  • Studio Rental: 150 Euro
  • Transport: 250 Euro (Cape Town & Holland)
  • Per diem: 450 Euro (Holland & Cape Town)
Perks
  • 0 - 50 - Mention on social media and thank you note
  • 50 - 150 - Attend an open rehearsal and meet with cast, plus mention on after campaign media
  • 150 - 350 - Attend an open rehearsal, personalized thank you letter from me, invitation to future performances
  • 350+ complimentary ticket to the festival
  • 500+ performance at an event of your choice
PS: Our rehearsals will always be open to contributors and I am great at giving hugs :)

story:
OUR MISSION

Although Women's Rights have made significant strides in our lifetime, it is still an uphill battle. A woman still makes 80 cents to the dollar, her professional capabilities are often doubted, and her opportunities are still often limited simply because of gender.  Our mission with this production is to bring a greater awareness of  these problems and their undeniable existence in today's world. Through your donation, you give strength to our message; you will be supporting a production that is written by a woman and directed by a woman.  It is a celebration of the contribution women are continually making to the arts, the business world, and to social issues. Your gift will help in this fight to break through the glass ceiling!

Theresa Rebeck is a playwright very dear to our hearts because of the pure, truthful way she writes as well as the outstanding creative opportunities her works provide for women. As art so often imitates life, What We’re Up Against reflects the mission of Life Force Arts. We dedicate this production to the actor, the musician, the artist, the human being…to anyone with conviction of their ability and the often challenging path towards opportunity and achievement.

 

WHAT WE NEED AND WHY

Theater has always been a vital form of expression and we are honored to be among it’s force of messengers. The most common challenge - and sadly often obstacle - to creating a production is financing. We are hovering just above $30,000 in our expenses. WHAT?!  Yes, that’s right. We are grateful for any support.  Aside from obvious expenses such as Insurance, Licensing Rights, and Artist Fees, there are numerous other day to day expenses.  Here is a look at some of those and how your contribution can help!

 

$25 buys: 1 hour rehearsal space; Weekly Metrocard for Intern

$50 buys: 2 hours rehearsal space

$100 buys: 1 month storage space for set materials

$200 buys: 500 postcards; 10 posters

$300 buys: 2 hours movers and van for material transport; One half of our costume budget; Programs for audience members

$600 buys: 1 day of theater rental

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

-Donate here

-Come and see the show!

-Like us on Facebook -  https://www.facebook.com/What-Were-Up-Against-508674242662433/

-Join the conversation on our website! let us know your thoughts/experiences! www.whatwereupagainst.com

 

CAST

Vince Bandille (NJ Playhouse 22), Lesley McBurney* (Onion News Network, The Public Theatre), Cherie Mendez (LA Indie Fest Winner), Bones Rodriguez* (ARS Nova, Law & Order: SVU), Ean Sheehy* (NY Theatre Workshop, The Public Theatre), and understudy Alejandro Santoni (Judas Iscariot, Actors Studio).

 

ARTISTIC COMPANY

The production is directed by Lorca Peress**(Public Theatre, MultiStages), set design by Jennifer Varbalow (Roundabout Theatre Co., The Drilling Co.), lighting design by Jason Fok (Classical Theatre of Harlem, Portland Stage), original music by Joel Harrison (Guggenheim Fellow, Jazz Composer’s Alliance Composition Winner), costume design by Lisa Renee Jordan (NYMTF Design Award, Drama Desk Nominee), video/projection design by Christopher Marston (indie filmmaker), Carpentry by Dan Teachout, Assistant Stage Manager Andrea Pimental, and Production Stage Manager Dustin Z. West* (Broadway: Shuffle Along, Off Broadway: Delirium’s Daughters).

                                * Appearing Courtesy of AEA      **SDC Member

                                                    AEA-approved showcase

 

PERFORMANCES

October 21-29

Fri., 10/21 at 7:00pm

Sat., 10/22 at 7:00pm

Sun., 10/23 at 2:00pm (Talk Back following the show);

Tues., 10/25 at 7:00pm

Wed., 10/26 at 7:00pm

Thurs., 10/27 at 7:00pm

Fri., 10/28 at 7:00pm (Benefit Performance)

Sat., 10/29 at 2:00pm and 7:00pm. 

Matinees will be held on Sun., 10/23 at 2:00pm and Sat., 10/29 at 2:00pm.

Tickets are $18.00 (general seating) and $12.00 (students, available at theater)

Please visit www.whatwereupagainst.com for tickets and information or call OVATION TIX AT (212)352-3101

 

ABOUT LIFE FORCE ARTS

LIFE FORCE ARTS, INC. is a not-for-profit that aims to encourage greater knowledge, understanding, and appreciation of the arts while igniting conversation about vital issues in the world around us. Life Force Arts, together with director Lorca Peress and Company, bring this mission to life in this timely, thought provoking production.

story:
PLOT: "Sean Gibbs, a high schooler who has yet to be kissed, gets the lead role in the school play, Je T'aime, where his character has to end the show with kissing the very attractive and popular female lead--Alexis Bryant.​

After becoming emotionally attached and madly in love with the disinterested girl who took his first kiss, the two find themselves distraught and at their wits' end in Relationship Counseling with a Therapist who may not be as legitimate as their friends led them to believe."

---

PUBLISHING & SHOW GOALS

After hiring Craig Russell Mason last year to create the Music Book and Orchestration, I am thrilled to say that the show is just about ready to be Published and Marketed! 

SGSK was first performed at San Jose State University with SPOTLITE Stage Company in Spring of 2014, and after being well received, I decided to work on Packaging the Show to allow the possibility of other Theater Companies to produce and perform it!

In the 2 years since its performance, my initial roadblock came in creating the sheet music for the show--as I was in no way able to create all that was needed for the show on my own. Luckily, I was able to add Craig to my team, who had just the talent and skills I was lacking!

Now that Script has been finalized, and the Music Book & Orchestration are being finalized, I am moving on to the FINAL steps of this whole project!

Specific Goals to Accomplish:

  • Record an Official Soundtrack of the Show
  • Publish Script, Music Book, Orchestration Book, & Soundtrack
  • Publishing Party/Cabaret Night Event
  • Find the First Theater Company to Produce the newly published SGSK

FUNDING & EXPENSES

What exactly is this $5,000+ going towards!?

---

Well, I am glad you asked! Currently there are (3) Major Funding Needs, with (1) Other Expenses Need required to accomplish all of this!

  • Musicians & Vocalists: The majority of the money needed will be going towards paying the talented Musicians & Vocalists that will be recording the Official Soundtrack, as well as performing a live sing-through of the show at the Publishing Party/Cabaret Night Event. I am treating this as a professional project, which means paying talent! This also includes the Music Director who will teach the music to everyone and run this end of the project!
  • Recording Studio & Music Publishing: The next big chunk of the budget goes towards the recording costs and music publishing costs associated with recording the Official Soundtrack. While it looks like I will be able to use the SJSU Recording Studios, there are still expenses associated with this that will need to be paid--though I am ECSTATIC and very grateful to be able to record here!
  • Publishing Party/Cabaret Night Event: The final section of the budget that will be high in cost is the Event I am planning to have. Not only will this Event be a way to celebrate this accomplishment with all of YOU (!), but it will also serve as a way to market the show to interested parties. This means Event Space Rental, Setup/Technician Expenses, Light F&B Expenses, and Marketing the Event to interested parties.
  • Other Expenses: Photo Shoot, FB/Social Media Marketing, Programs for the Event, Light Marketing, Etc.

THE PERKS (WHAT YOU GET!!!)

This was honestly the most fun section of creating this campaign and I am super excited to get you excited for the generous contributions you give--for I could not accomplish this without YOU and YOUR HELP!

---

PDF of "The Making of Sean Gibbs' STAGE KISS" 

One of the most common questions I get when I tell people I create musicals is how I do it and the process behind it--so, I have written an awesome PDF to send you about how I created SGSK!

---

Handwritten PUNKPOST Card

I will be sending you an RAD Handwritten Card from an Awesome San Francisco Start Up I am working for as a Scriptist. Find them at: http://punkpost.co/ (Your First Card Sent with them is FREE!!!)

---

SGSK Sticker

YOU GUYS--I ordered 500 of these babies, so please contribute if for no other reason than to get these off my hands. But really--I think they look pretty sharp, and am super happy with how they turned out. 

---

Signed Script

Receive a signed Script of SGSK with all your other goodies, so that you can read the show and come to the Publishing Party/Cabaret Event ready to go with the full story in your brain!

---

SGSK Tank Top

Specially designed for you, with the SGSK Logo, this Tank is super comfortable and easy to wear. No annoying itchy tag either! 

---

SGSK Sweatshirt

Man, will you be looking Hot in this SGSK Sweatshirt. I love nothing more than sweatshirts--so why not add this into the mix!? (Please Note: Sizings run SMALL in this brand of sweatshirt, so I suggest ordering a size up!)

---

MEET YOUR TEAM

  • M. Marlin White: MYSELF! The creator of Sean Gibbs' STAGE KISS in its Book, Music, & Lyrics! I'm super creative and enjoy doing multiple things at once to prevent getting bored. Ready to accomplish lots! Find myself and more info at: https://www.mmarlinwhite.com 
  • Craig Russell Mason: Craig is SGSK's Arranger & Orchestrator, as well as will be the Musical Director for this Project! He is currently studying music composition at San José State University, working toward his Bachelor of Music degree. He has picked up a variety of instruments over the years, including clarinets, flutes, saxophones, guitar, and singing. He started writing simple songs in his teens, and decided to pursue his passion as a career in music.
  • KMC Photography: Merchandise, Gear, & Promotional Photos all done by KMC Photography. Check out Kevin's work at: http://www.kevinmcphotography.com/
  • CustomInk: Not only did I design all my Merchandise & Gear here, but their Customer Service is TOP NOTCH (Shoutout to Crisi!), and they so graciously sent me the LOGO, which is seen on all the Perks you're getting! Find them, Use them: https://www.customink.com
  • YOUUUUUU!!!: Where would any of this be without you!? That's right, you are a part of the team, and I'm pretty sure you know yourself pretty well--or at least I hope you do!

CONCLUSION...for NOW!

As a Writer and Creative person, I tend to write books with these types of things--so CONGRATULATIONS for making it this far and to the end! I hope you are now well educated on the purpose and goals I have for not only this campaign, but for SGSK in itself! 

My drive for getting this accomplished is one that has strengthened over the years of this project, and is one that will help me make this all a reality. This drive also now includes you and your support--as you are a huge part to bringing this all to life.

And just think--come the end of the year, we will have created a lasting project that has the potential to be performed just about anywhere! A Script, Music Book, Orchestration Book, & Official Soundtrack. All thanks to you!

I will be releasing more information on this page as everything progresses, as well as my FB Fanpage, so STAY TUNED! (Also to come is the date for the Event, because you are most Definitely Invited!!!)

Once Again:

THANK YOU!

 

M. Marlin White

THE PERKS (WHAT YOU GET!!!)This was honestly the most fun section of creating this campaign and I am super excited to get you excited for the generous contributions you give--for I could not accomplish this without YOU and YOUR HELP!---PDF of "The Making of Sean Gibbs' STAGE KISS" One of the most common questions I get when I tell people I create musicals is how I do it and the process behind it--so, I have written an awesome PDF to send you about how I created SGSK!---Handwritten PUNKPOST CardI will be sending you an RAD Handwritten Card from an Awesome San Francisco Start Up I am working for as a Scriptist. Find them at: http://punkpost.co/ (Your First Card Sent with them is FREE!!!)---SGSK StickerYOU GUYS--I ordered 500 of these babies, so please contribute if for no other reason than to get these off my hands. But really--I think they look pretty sharp, and am super happy with how they turned out. ---Signed ScriptReceive a signed Script of SGSK with all your other goodies, so that you can read the show and come to the Publishing Party/Cabaret Event ready to go with the full story in your brain!---SGSK Tank TopSpecially designed for you, with the SGSK Logo, this Tank is super comfortable and easy to wear. No annoying itchy tag either! ---SGSK SweatshirtMan, will you be looking Hot in this SGSK Sweatshirt. I love nothing more than sweatshirts--so why not add this into the mix!? (Please Note: Sizings run SMALL in this brand of sweatshirt, so I suggest ordering a size up!)---MEET YOUR TEAM

M. Marlin White: MYSELF! The creator of Sean Gibbs' STAGE KISS in its Book, Music, & Lyrics! I'm super creative and enjoy doing multiple things at once to prevent getting bored. Ready to accomplish lots! Find myself and more info at: https://www.mmarlinwhite.com 

Craig Russell Mason: Craig is SGSK's Arranger & Orchestrator, as well as will be the Musical Director for this Project! He is currently studying music composition at San José State University, working toward his Bachelor of Music degree. He has picked up a variety of instruments over the years, including clarinets, flutes, saxophones, guitar, and singing. He started writing simple songs in his teens, and decided to pursue his passion as a career in music.

KMC Photography: Merchandise, Gear, & Promotional Photos all done by KMC Photography. Check out Kevin's work at: http://www.kevinmcphotography.com/


CustomInk: Not only did I design all my Merchandise & Gear here, but their Customer Service is TOP NOTCH (Shoutout to Crisi!), and they so graciously sent me the LOGO, which is seen on all the Perks you're getting! Find them, Use them: https://www.customink.com


YOUUUUUU!!!: Where would any of this be without you!? That's right, you are a part of the team, and I'm pretty sure you know yourself pretty well--or at least I hope you do!
CONCLUSION...for NOW!As a Writer and Creative person, I tend to write books with these types of things--so CONGRATULATIONS for making it this far and to the end! I hope you are now well educated on the purpose and goals I have for not only this campaign, but for SGSK in itself! My drive for getting this accomplished is one that has strengthened over the years of this project, and is one that will help me make this all a reality. This drive also now includes you and your support--as you are a huge part to bringing this all to life.And just think--come the end of the year, we will have created a lasting project that has the potential to be performed just about anywhere! A Script, Music Book, Orchestration Book, & Official Soundtrack. All thanks to you!I will be releasing more information on this page as everything progresses, as well as my FB Fanpage, so STAY TUNED! (Also to come is the date for the Event, because you are most Definitely Invited!!!)Once Again:THANK YOU! M. Marlin White

story:
Our Story

Hi, my name is Alvin Erasga Tolentino, Artistic Director and founder of Co.ERASGA Dance Company. As an artist of both Canada and the Philippines I believe in the value of indigenous culture and the exchange of ideas across borders. This year Co.ERASGA created and produced Collected, Traces and Still Here, a collaborative show starring seven talented dancers from Canada and the Philippines.This creation is based on the ancient gesture "Mudras" and traditional fabric "Malong" - a Filipino fabric used in daily life. The dancers are the canvasses of motion which evoke traditional practices still relevant and existing today. 

With a successful run in Vancouver BC, it is now time to tour the show to the Philippines, and we need your help! This creation shares the importance of heritage, and in addition to performing in 4 regions of the Philippines, we will conduct youth workshops and shows for students. The money raised will go towards enabling those who do not always have the privilege of partaking in the arts an opportunity to explore their cultural roots through dance. Help us honour the past and inspire the future! 

 

The Impact

Our goal is to raise $8,000 on Indigogo to supplement our existing finances. We have budgeted for the last year, and thanks to funds raised through shows and grants, we are on our way to the second phase of this cultural exchange, the tour of the Philippines. We need your help to get us all of the way there!

Your contribution will go towards transportation to schools, workshops, artists' per diem, flights, fees, costume care and accommodation. Thanks to you, this important  dance creation will bridge two countries and influence the communities of artists in both Canada and the Philippines.

Donate what you can, every amount counts. Donations will go to the following:

$10 - towards healthy meals while on the road
$25 - towards transportation
$50 - towards Per Diem
$100 - towards accommodation
$500 - towards artist fees
$1000+ - towards plane ticket

Any additional funds will go towards a category on the list above. Our priority is sharing this piece of dance globally, and care will be taken to allocate funds where they will have the most impact. Each year Co.ERASGA tours a show as a part of its international mandate, reaching less privileged communities where arts can have an impact. Collected, Traces, and Still Here is Co.ERASGA's largest undertaking to date. With successful tours every year, we are eager to continue our work, share and provide art with those less fortunate. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help:

Get the word out and make some noise!
Use the Indiegogo share tools, spread the word on Social and let your friends and family know. We appreciate it all!

Thank you so much for your support,

Alvin and Co.ERASGA

www.companyerasgadance.ca

 

Tour Dates & Locations

 

January 23- February 19, 2017

Makiling Inter-Cultural Arts Festival at the National Arts Center Theater in Los Banos Laguna

Carmen D.Locsin Dance Foundation at Locsin-Lanang Theatre in Davao

At Diliman University of the Philippines in Manila

The PARCFoundation Philippines-San Juan

 

The Dancers

RALPH ESCAMILLAN

Ralph started his training at age 14 at Harbour Dance Centre Vancouver, BC. His passion for training has exposed him to a plethora of dance styles making him a truly versatile dance artist.  www.ralphescamillan.com.


WALTER KUBANEK

Walter is a dance artist with 2 decades of experience making and performing dance.  He is happy  to be joining Co.ERASGA for this project.

MOLLY MCDERMOTT

Originally from Edmonton, AB, Molly McDermott is currently residing and working as an independent dance artist in Vancouver, BC.

KRIS-BELLE PACLIBAR-MAMANGUN

Paclibar-Mamangun is an active freelance performer, dance teacher and choreographer in Manila, Philippines. Born and raised in Davao City in the Philippines, she started dancing at the age nine at the Locsin Dance Workshop.

OLIVIA SHAFFER

Olivia Shaffer is an independent dancer and improviser from Vancouver, BC. Her formative training includes 10 years of Cecchetti Ballet and a BFA from SFU Contemporary Dance.

RONELSON YADAO

Ronelson is a Philippine High School for the Arts-Ballet alumnus. He continued his dance studies at De La Salle-College of Saint Benilde (DLS-CSB) while being a soloist at Ballet Philippines (BP).

SOPHIA WOLFE

Sophia Wolfe is a Vancouver based contemporary dance artist who also works in photography and dance on screen. She completed her post secondary dance training through Modus Operandi.

 

Photo & video credit: Yasuhiro Okada

story:
SPINOZA'S ETHICS

Inspired by the true story of an extraordinary and average woman's struggle for love and faith in 1960s America, Spinoza's Ethics follows Ruth as she weaves in and out of marriages, vocations, and states of existence, accompanied always by the early Enlightenment philosopher Baruch Spinoza. 
Because everything that is simply is.

About the team

Playwright Emily Claire Schmitt believes in magic in everyday life.  An up-and-coming playwright in NYC with a BA in Theater and Philosophy from Saint Mary’s College and an MFA in Playwriting from The New School for Drama, Emily has authored seven full-length plays. Most recently, Whatchamacallit: A Play About Jesus  received it's world premier at The Secret Theater. She hopes that her plays might reconnect audiences with that deep, primal, mysticism that is so missing from our modern lives.
Director Dianna Garten fell in love with the transcendent qualities of theater at six years old when she first saw Anne of Green Gables. With a BFA in Drama from NYU and an MA in Applied Theatre from CUNY, she seeks work that contains possibilities for immense theatricality, that probe deep questions about how we live our modern lives. She hopes to create theater that pulls audiences in and encourages them to ask lots and lots of questions.

What We Need & What You Get

Your generous contribution will go to the basic necessities of making live theatre happen. You will be supporting the development of new writing and a strong female creative team. We are hoping to raise $4,500 to cover the cost of the production.

Funds will go to:

  • making it live: paying the amazing actors
  • making it beautiful: sound, lighting, and costume designers
  • making it breathe: rehearsal space
  • making it real: props and costumes
  • making it possible: festival fee
  • making it known: advertising and printed materials
  • making it sweet: creative team stipends

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone is able to contribute financially to our project, but there are lots of ways to support.  Some other ideas are:  
  • Come see the show!
  • Spread the word about "Spinoza's Ethics" on social media.
  • Encourage others to contribute to the Indiegogo Campaign.
  • Give Dianna a hug.
  • Dust off that Descartes you never read in high school and give it a read.
  • Go see the play that your struggling actor friend is in, and let them know how proud you are.

story:
Dig Infinity!

Apocalypso Theatre Collective is thrilled to announce that Dig Infinity! has been accepted to the 2015 New York International Fringe Festival this August! Hip-Hip Hooray!

So now comes the hard (and fun!) work: we are planning a more elaborate and ambitious production this season and need YOUR generosity in allowing us to expand our vision.

Lord Who? Dig What?

Dig Infinity! is an award-winning immersive theatrical experience celebrating the legacy of Lord Buckley  (1906-1960), a jazz comedian, visionary storyteller/philosopher, hipster saint and premier beatnik rapper.

Lord Buckley was best known for transforming Bible stories, Shakespeare soliloquies, the Classics, myth, legend and history into one-of-a-kind hip-talk monologues combining African-American street argot and the King’s English into a jazzy patois and worldview that anticipated psychedelia and rap by decades. "Jonah & The Whale," "The Hip Gahn," "Scrooge," "Hipsters, Flipsters & Finger-Poppin' Daddies," and "The Nazz" are just a few of his hallmark monologues that are the stuff of bohemian fable.

Dig Infinity! received its first full productions at the 2014 Planet Connections Theatre Festivity and garnered three of the fest's top honors: Outstanding Production of an Adaptation, Outstanding Lead Actor (Oliver Trager) and Outstanding Supporting Actor (Russell Jordan).

Dig Infinity! transpires in a surreal radio station where, on the midnight after his death, Lord Buckley spins out his life story to a DJ named Orpheus while demonstrating his signature material. As the two talk, a dialogue interspersed with flashbacks to various points in Lord Buckley's life, the conversation shifts into a discussion about the importance of truth and art, a topic which includes a trip to Hades and a cameo by God as it becomes increasingly apparent that Lord Buckley is bargaining for his very soul.

Lord Buckley’s life and art remain so resonantly timely and why each new generation seems to rediscover and revere his legacy are the ways in which it confronts and comments on controversial components of contemporary American life: religion, language, art, sex, drugs, and race.

Yet despite being a secret subterranean hero to the likes of Bob Dylan, Robin Williams, the Beatles, Grateful Dead, Bill T. Jones, Ken Kesey, Joni Mitchell, Tom Waits, Julie Taymor, George Carlin, Whoopi Goldberg, Henry Miller, Laurence Olivier, Roseanne, Jimmy Buffett, Joan Baez and scores of others, Buckley's achievement has remained tragically overlooked.


The Artists

Dig Infinity! is written, directed by and features Oliver Trager (Lord Buckley's biographer, performer and a keeper of the flame) in the lead role. Oliver has shared His Lordship's work in a variety of settings and media for more than two decades.

Dig Infinity! is graced by a dedicated and talented circle of actors and musicians who have thus far worked for the love of the project and precious few shekels. Foremost amongst these are Russell Jordan (http://www.russelljordan.com/) playing the role of Orpheus and John Kruth leading the band.

Russell has distinguished himself in a number of productions over the past few years. John is a founding member of the transcendent World Beat jazz band Tribecastan (http://tribecastan.tv/) that has performed frequently in and around NYC and toured both Europe and the West Coast.

Rounding out our humble cast is multi-threat actor Ridley Parson and ace Tribecastan drummer-man Boris Kinberg.




The Treasury

Funds are needed for there following costs:

Festival Registration Fee: $700

Venue Director: $500

Insurance: $300

Cast and Crew Compensation: $5000

Printing: $300

Rehearsal Space Rental: $1200

PR & Marketing: $2000

Your generosity will ensure a top shelf production and help spread a bit of Buckley's gospel -- a vision of a better world!

We are all proud that Dig Infinity! has been selected to be presented at this year's FringeNYC -- one of the city's premier arts festivals.

To give you an idea of how we have handled the material, this cool review of our first staged reading should give you a notion of what we have conjured:  http://www.diglordbuckley.com/reviews/


THE NYC INTERNATIONAL FRINGE FESTIVAL 2015:

The New York International Fringe Festival, or FringeNYC, is a theatre festival and one of the largest multi-arts events in North America. It takes place over the course of two weeks every August and presents around 200 companies from all over the world. The selection process is very competitive accepting only 20% of their applicants from a pool of around 1,000 submissions. 

Fringe NYC has served as a platform for important shows and companies, including Broadway musicals like "Urinetown", And has also being a stepping stone for Tony award nominees and winners.


Other Ways You Can Help

We welcome your contribution, no matter its form.

If you’re unable to contribute financially, you can help by spreading the word about Dig Infinity! to as many friends, family, and fellow seekers as possible.

You can:

  • Copy and paste this URL into an email and send it to your email list

  • Share our campaign link on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.

For more on Dig Infinity!: http://www.diglordbuckley.com

For more on Lord Buckley: http://lordbuckley.com

For a taste of vintage Lord Buckley:


THANK YOU! WE APPRECIATE YOUR SUPPORT!

Straight From the Road of Love,

Oliver Trager, Head Head


Illustration at top: J.R. Williams

You can:

Copy and paste this URL into an email and send it to your email list
Share our campaign link on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.
