story:
About Myself

Hello! 

My name is Anastasia Rybachuk. I’m Russian and write poems in Russian and in English and perform on TV and live on stage.


People often tell me that my performances inspire them to write their own poems. That before they saw me on TV, they never thought that poetry might not bore them to death. It can make them smile! 


In fact, even the reviewers’ faces seem to light up – they nominated me for the National Literary Award ‘Poet of the Year 2015’.

My poetry is controversial and eccentric. For some unknown reason, my performances break all the rules, and alter the standards by which people usually judge poetry, theatre and female comedy.



So the Edinburgh Fringe is the perfect place for me. It’s the boldest festival in the world with no boundaries and limits, defying the norm for the whole universe! A triumph of creativity and artistic freedom!

I was brave (or crazy) enough to take part in the 2015 Edinburgh Fringe. To say that it blew my mind would be an understatement.


It was also a great experience in terms of the sense of anticipation and running around like a headless chicken even though I had no idea about what kind of adventure and surprises were waiting for me. There are no festivals on such a large scale in Russia and none of my colleagues have taken part in the Edinburgh Fringe (or any kind of the Fringe) before. So it was like one small step to reaching the Moon for both Russian poetry and comedy!


Despite all the challenges, my performance was a success with BBC confirming this in its article. Hurrah!

About My Dream

Now I do want to repeat and certainly outdo my own performance in the next Fringe – with all the experience I gained last year and all the passion for art I’ve always had, in the largest, busiest and the most successful venue at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe, TheSpaceUK.


For the 2016 Edinburgh Fringe, I’ve written and directed a show which comprises poems, spoken word and songs. It also includes digital stage design and elements of choreography.

The show covers a wide range of topics. Among them are common stereotypes, complexes and fears, relations between men and women, sex, politics and even environmental protection! What unites these topics is my approach. I present them in a way to invoke debate. I try to reach the point where evil turns into good and vice versa. When comedy looks like tragedy and tragedy seems to be ridiculous.

The show’s going to be very dynamic and will keep the audience glued to their seats for forty-five minutes. And, of course, be prepared to blush and most importantly laugh out loud!

I’m so passionate about my show that I want to share it with the whole world. I felt happy every moment I was writing it. I understand that it’s beyond the laws of nature – performing it in English despite being Russian - but it makes me even more excited!


About the Impact

I’m sure that one day human beings will fly to Mars but if we don’t learn to understand each other on Earth before it, our problems will never be solved. So maybe this poetry show in English is my personal way of dealing with the conflicts and misunderstandings that exist on this planet today.

In my view, it is remarkable that someone is so eager to write and perform in a second language. It’s remarkable for the whole world! It proves that although the Tower of Babel was destroyed  many years ago, we all still have a chance.

So by supporting my show I invite you to put your brick in the Tower of Babel 2016 style. We’ve all learnt a lot since that first attempt so we can’t but succeed now!

It would be a very exciting trip for both of us – my trip to the English soul by means of your language, and your trip to the Russian soul by means of my rhymes.


I must warn you that it all may end up in a very unexpected way... :-) But we will enjoy this funny and exciting trip, I promise! 

So here we go!


What I Need & What You Get

One might be right in thinking that $30,854 is a huge sum of money. It adds up astonishingly quickly when you have to pay for festival fees, venue costs, insurance, travel and transportation costs, accommodation and marketing costs in addition to the props, costumes, and license fees for the images and music you’ll see and hear onstage.

To sum up your donation should cover the following:

  • Fringe Society registration fee $580.
  • Venue cost $5,225 – the largest, busiest and the most successful venue of the Edinburgh Festival Fringe is worth it.
  • Marketing expenses $5,000 – there were about 4000 participants in the 2015 Edinburgh Fringe, so without marketing no one will ever know about my show ☹  This sum includes the hiring of a PR manager, posters & flyers (photo, design & print), English version of the site, advertising in brochures & newspapers, online advertising, etc.
  • Video production $2,000 – video shooting of my show, and further editing and production of the full and promo videos for those who may not be able to attend the show in August.
  • Transportation $3,000 – yes, Russia is very far away.
  • Accommodation $5,000 – I wouldn’t stay in a posh hotel, such as Marriott. Edinburgh is quite an expensive place to stay in August, sadly.
  • Food $600 – something to eat in August.
  • Choreographer $1,600 – three times a week over a three month period before the show.
  • Dancers $2,000 – two dancers performing with me onstage.
  • Technician $1,000 – to make sure the sound does not fade while I’m onstage.
  • Music $364 – to pay for the tracks which play in the background during my performance.
  • Costumes $800 – for both myself and my dancers
  • Props $600 – to enrich the overall perception of the show.
  • Indiegogo fee (5%) – $1,542.
  • PayPal fee (5%) -  $1,542.

All of the donator perks are listed on the right-hand side of this page. Click on the perk to claim it, or simply donate using the link at the top of the page if you don't wish to receive any perks.

You can further support me even after my goal for this project is reached.

- I speak fluent English, but practice makes perfect, so additional funds will allow me to take extra elocution lessons and improve upon my level.

- You can support my YouTube video channel by donating for my new videos in English.

Any donation would make me extremely happy and grateful as it would give me an opportunity to continue sharing my creative work with the world. This is what I’m living for!


Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just can't afford to donate financially. But there are still ways you can help.

- Share this campaign with friends, family and coworkers who might be interested in donating, or share it on your social media for everyone to see.

- You can also share links to my social media and YouTube channel:

YouTube – https://www.youtube.com/user/NastyaRybachuk

Facebook – https://www.facebook.com/nastyrybka/

Twitter – https://twitter.com/nasty_rybka

Instagram – https://www.instagram.com/nasty_rybka/


What if I don't reach my entire goal? 

I would be honest with you – participating in the Fringe 2016 is very important for me. I feel like I must make it by all means. That’s why I will do my best to think of other ways to raise enough money. So if anyone knows a kidney surgeon to assist me with my next plan – feel free to provide me with their contact details :-)

Seriously, I would keep the raised funds for the Fringe 2017. I won't give up so easily! 


..but please Help Make it Happen in 2016!

I do hope that you can support my dream and we, together, can make the Fringe 2016 come true for me - it means a lot to me! 

Thank you very much! Большое спасибо!:-)

P. S.   I have a question for you guys -

                It drives me out of my wits.

                If something always grows in size,

                Then why a nose? It should be tits!
story_txt:
About Myself

Hello! 


My name is
Anastasia Rybachuk. I’m Russian and write poems in Russian and in English and
perform on TV and live on stage.



People often tell
me that my performances inspire them to write their own poems. That before they
saw me on TV, they never thought that poetry might not bore them to death. It can make them smile! 




In fact, even the reviewers’ faces seem to light up – they
nominated me for the National Literary Award ‘Poet of the Year 2015’.
My poetry is
controversial and eccentric. For some unknown reason, my performances break all the rules, and alter the
standards by which people usually judge poetry, theatre and female
comedy.

So the Edinburgh
Fringe is the perfect place for me. It’s the boldest festival in the world with
no boundaries and limits, defying the norm for the whole universe! A triumph of
creativity and artistic freedom! 
I was brave (or
crazy) enough to take part in the 2015 Edinburgh Fringe. To say that it blew my
mind would be an understatement.

It was also a great
experience in terms of the sense of anticipation and running around like a
headless chicken even though I had no idea about what kind of adventure and
surprises were waiting for me. There are no festivals on such a large scale in
Russia and none of my colleagues have taken part in the Edinburgh Fringe (or
any kind of the Fringe) before. So it was like one small step to reaching the
Moon for both Russian poetry and comedy!





Despite all the challenges, my performance was a success with BBC confirming this in its article. Hurrah!About My Dream
Now I do want to repeat and certainly outdo my own performance in the next Fringe – with
all the experience I gained last year and all the passion for art I’ve always
had, in the largest, busiest and the most successful venue at the Edinburgh
Festival Fringe, TheSpaceUK.



For the 2016
Edinburgh Fringe, I’ve written and directed a show which comprises poems,
spoken word and songs. It also includes digital stage design and elements of
choreography. 
The show covers a
wide range of topics. Among them are common stereotypes, complexes and fears,
relations between men and women, sex, politics and even environmental
protection! What unites these topics is my approach. I present them in a way to
invoke debate. I try to reach the point where evil turns into good and vice
versa. When comedy looks like tragedy and tragedy seems to be ridiculous. 
The show’s going to
be very dynamic and will keep the audience glued to their seats for forty-five
minutes. And, of course, be prepared to blush and most importantly laugh out
loud!
I’m so passionate
about my show that I want to share it with the whole world. I felt happy every
moment I was writing it. I understand that it’s beyond the laws of nature –
performing it in English despite being Russian - but it makes me even more
excited!



About the Impact
I’m sure that one
day human beings will fly to Mars but if we don’t learn to understand each
other on Earth before it, our problems will never be solved. So maybe this
poetry show in English is my personal way of dealing with the conflicts and misunderstandings
that exist on this planet today.
In my view, it is
remarkable that someone is so eager to write and perform in a second language.
It’s remarkable for the whole world! It proves that although the Tower of Babel
was destroyed  many years ago, we all still have a chance. 
So by supporting my
show I invite you to put your brick in the Tower of Babel 2016 style. We’ve all
learnt a lot since that first attempt so we can’t but succeed now!
It would be a very
exciting trip for both of us – my trip to the English soul by means of your
language, and your trip to the Russian soul by means of my rhymes. 



I must warn you
that it all may end up in a very unexpected way... :-) But we will enjoy this funny
and exciting trip, I promise! 
So here we go!


What I Need & What You Get

One might be right in thinking that $30,854 is a huge sum of money. It adds up astonishingly quickly when you have to pay for festival fees, venue costs, insurance, travel and transportation costs, accommodation and marketing costs in addition to the props, costumes, and license fees for the images and music you’ll see and hear onstage.
To sum up your donation should cover the following:


Fringe Society registration fee $580.

Venue cost $5,225 – the largest, busiest and the most successful venue of the Edinburgh Festival Fringe is worth it.


Marketing expenses $5,000 – there were about 4000 participants in the 2015 Edinburgh Fringe, so without marketing no one will ever know about my show ☹  This sum includes the hiring of a PR manager, posters & flyers (photo, design & print), English version of the site, advertising in brochures & newspapers, online advertising, etc.


Video production $2,000 – video shooting of my show, and further editing and production of the full and promo videos for those who may not be able to attend the show in August.


Transportation $3,000 – yes, Russia is very far away.


Accommodation $5,000 – I wouldn’t stay in a posh hotel, such as Marriott. Edinburgh is quite an expensive place to stay in August, sadly.


Food $600 – something to eat in August.


Choreographer $1,600 – three times a week over a three month period before the show.


Dancers $2,000 – two dancers performing with me onstage.


Technician $1,000 – to make sure the sound does not fade while I’m onstage.


Music $364 – to pay for the tracks which play in the background during my performance.


Costumes $800 – for both myself and my dancers


Props $600 – to enrich the overall perception of the show.


Indiegogo fee (5%) – $1,542.


PayPal fee (5%) -  $1,542.


All of the donator perks are listed on the right-hand side of this page. Click on the perk to claim it, or simply donate using the link at the top of the page if you don't wish to receive any perks. 
You can further support me even after my goal for this project is reached. 
- I speak fluent English, but practice makes perfect, so additional funds will allow me to take extra elocution lessons and improve upon my level.
- You can support my YouTube video channel by donating for my new videos in English.
Any donation would make me extremely happy and grateful as it would give me an opportunity to continue sharing my creative work with the world. This is what I’m living for!


Other Ways You Can Help
Sometimes you just can't afford to donate financially. But there are still ways you can help.
 - Share this campaign with friends, family and coworkers who might be interested in donating, or share it on your social media for everyone to see.
- You can also share links to my social media and YouTube channel:
YouTube – https://www.youtube.com/user/NastyaRybachuk
Facebook – https://www.facebook.com/nastyrybka/
Twitter – https://twitter.com/nasty_rybka
Instagram – https://www.instagram.com/nasty_rybka/


What if I don't reach my entire goal? 
I would be honest with you – participating in the Fringe 2016 is very important for me. I feel like I must make it by all means. That’s why I will do my best to think of other ways to raise enough money. So if anyone knows a kidney surgeon to assist me with my next plan – feel free to provide me with their contact details :-)
Seriously, I would keep the raised funds for the Fringe 2017. I won't give up so easily! 


..but please Help Make it Happen in 2016!
I do hope that you can support my dream and we, together, can make the Fringe 2016 come true for me - it means a lot to me! 



Thank you very much! Большое спасибо!:-)
P. S.   I have a question for you guys -

                It drives me out of my wits.
                If something always grows in size,
                Then why a nose? It should be tits!

story:
Project Summary

With the growing tech presence fanning the flames of the housing crisis, how can there be development without displacement in Oakland? What do Oakland’s histories of displacement, resistance, and change-making reveal about the path to a just future? And what does an ideal future look like for Oakland? Through community interviews, personal stories, original music, and physical exploration―and a deep dive into Oakland’s past―The Bonfire Makers will build a play that imagines what the future of Oakland could look like if we disrupt current cycles of oppression. By juxtaposing past and future, we will explore what "development," "urban renewal," and "health" have meant, do mean, and could mean and illuminate the concrete steps that can be taken to make a just future for all of Oakland a reality.

Our play―PLACE to LAND (an oakland love story)―will empower people who care about Oakland to dream big, see that the changes we long to see are wholly possible, and take action. Each performance will be followed by a community dialogue with audience members (which may feature a panel discussion with longtime residents, organizers, and others on the front lines of policy advocacy). Select performances will raise money for grassroots racial and economic justice organizations working hard for Oakland everyday, including our community partner Alliance of Californians for Community Empowerment (ACCE), a member-based organization that fights to end displacement in Oakland.

Performance Dates, Times, & Locations:

PREVIEW: Thursday, June 2nd @ 8 pm: The Flight Deck (1540 Broadway, Oakland) 

OPENING:  Saturday, June 4 @ 8 pm: InterPlayce (2273 Telegraph Ave, Oakland)

Sunday, June 5 @ 7 pm: SPUR Oakland (1544 Broadway, Oakland)

Thursday, June 9 @ 8 pm: The Omni Commons (4799 Shattuck Ave, Oakland)

NEW LOCATION :: Friday, June 10 @ 8 pm, HOMEish (605 Lancaster St, Oakland)

Saturday, June 11 @ 8 pm, Sole Space (1714 Telegraph Ave, Oakland)

ACCE BENEFIT PERFORMANCE: Sunday, June 12 @ 3 pm, The Omni Commons (4799 Shattuck Ave, Oakland)

*PANEL from 5:15-6:15, how can we take action (or deepen the actions we are taking) to make a future free of systemic oppression? at the Omni Commons. FREE!

Sunday, June 12th@ 7 pm, The Omni Commons (4799 Shattuck Ave, Oakland)

Tickets: $15-$35, sliding scale. Each performance is also pay-what-you-can at the door: nobody turned away for lack of funds.

 

Who We Are

We are The Bonfire Makers: a political performance collective who use theater, like a bonfire, to draw diverse audiences around a shared experience. By building evocative performances gathered from community stories and ensemble collaboration, we illuminate diverse experiences, spark dialogue, and ignite change. We recognize that we live under systems that entrench inequalities, a reality deeply felt in the Bay Area, and our work springs from, speaks to, and seeks to heal these injustices. We embrace theater as a people’s tool for resistance, re-imagining, and transformation.

From our Paul Dresher Ensemble Artist Residency. 
CORE ENSEMBLE:
Tierra Allen: constantly moving, constantly singing, constantly dreaming of collective liberation.
Melissa Carter: aspires to slow down, make lots of art and music, listen more fully, drink lemon water daily, and build lots of bonfires.
Sonia Decker: artist, community member, childcare provider, and lover of humanity and nature.
Maurice André San-Chez: fighting oppression at its core, and educating a younger generation on how they can do the same.
Sango Tajima: Artist. Nomad. Dreamer. Maker.
Alex Van-Gils: (b.1987) is a bassist and composer whose music is inspired by his love of Shambhala Buddhism, synthesizers, comic books, and people.

COLLABORATING ARTISTS:
Zach Kopciak: dramaturg, deviser, producer, director, and performer who has worked across the United States and England.
Phil Wong: acting, singing, creating, destroying, laughing, writing, fighting, and bouncing through Oakland since 1990.

(See full artist bios here).

COMMUNITY PARTNERS:


An ACCE action on Wells Fargo Bank in Oakland in 2015.

The Alliance of Californians for Community Empowerment (ACCE) is a grassroots, member-led, statewide community organization working with more than 10,000 members across California. ACCE believes in change from the bottom up and takes seriously their commitment to ground-up organizing to build a strong people’s movement that can create transformative community change. The Bonfire Makers are partnering with ACCE's Oakland Chapter, interviewing members and staff about their visions for Oakland. We are donating a percentage of ticket sales from a benefit performance of PLACE to LAND (an oakland love story) to further the important work they do to create a just future for our city.  


Project History

“Alternating between soliloquy, multi-character scenes, song and dance routines, and audience interaction, ‘We Go Boom’ created a fun and thought-provoking atmosphere to discuss the effect of technology in the Bay area.” (The Berkeley Graduate)

PLACE to LAND (an oakland love story) will extend the questions raised by The Bonfire Makers' first ensemble-created theater piece, WE GO BOOM!, which premiered in March and April 2015 at the Temescal Arts Center, the Omni Commons, and UC Berkeley. Centered around the opening of downtown Oakland’s newest tech hub Uptown Station, WE GO BOOM! explored the impact of the tech industry on the city of Oakland, asking: How does the tech industry effect long-time Oakland residents and residents of color? How is technology changing the way we interact with our communities?  Why is there a lack of diversity in the tech industry? Can technology be a tool of social justice? Where do we go from here?

WE GO BOOM! at TAC and UC Berkeley. For a video sample, click here.

The impact of our work on the audiences we gathered was overwhelming: the majority of our audiences stayed to participate in post-show forums, hungry to share experiences, pose questions, and exchange knowledge about how to achieve development without displacement. Longtime Oakland resident Nicole Dixon felt that our work was “amazing, and it shined light around the complexities of the issue” (as reported in Oakland North).

As tech surges in Oakland (we now know Uber will occupy Uptown Station), and Mayor Schaaf pushes “techquity” as a solution to growing inequalities, we wish to push the conversation forward from awareness of tech’s impact on our city toward solutions to ensuring just outcomes. With PLACE to LAND (an oakland love story), we will deeply explore the histories of displacement and resistance in the Bay, learn what we can do to ensure a just future for Oakland, and empower our neighbors to act.


What We Need & What You Get

We need the support of our neighbors who love Oakland, and want a future that can hold and take care of all of us, to secure the time, space, and tools to build this piece of theater. This project is for our communities, and accountable to our communities. If you are hungry to explore the questions we are, to learn how the changes you ache to see can happen, to activate more of your neighbors to support the incredible movement work you are already doing―please help us create this project.

We have already secured some crucial support for PLACE to LAND (an oakland love story): we won a residency from Paul Dresher Ensemble in West Oakland to support our rehearsal process and are augmenting this opportunity with work-trade agreements earning us rehearsal time at Youth Musical Theater Company and Shotgun Studios. But this still leaves us with expenses.

We’ve budgeted:

  • $5000 to support the 8 artists working to build this show.

  • $1000 to rent performance space and equipment.

  • $1100 to cover all other direct show costs: marketing materials, advertising, research materials, props, costumes, set, refreshments for panelists, script printing, our BART fare/bus fare/gas and tolls, and more.

  • $900 in overhead to make our collective, and this work, sustainable: video and photo documentation and editing, web hosting, the cuts taken by Indiegogo and BrownPaperTickets, and more.

We hope to earn $1000 from ticket sales (with a priority on making tickets affordable), after the percentage donated directly to our community partners. We are granted $250 from our Paul Dresher Ensemble Artist Residency. Will you donate to help us cover our remaining costs?

If we do not meet our fundraising goal, funds will be prioritized to cover performance space, equipment rental, and other direct show costs.



The Impact

This project is vital now. We are in a crisis, evidenced by the more than 1,000 evictions happening per month in Oakland. As the Bay Area becomes the tech capital of the world, gentrification has emerged as the newest form of displacement in a long line of systemic violence perpetrated against black folks in Oakland, including “segregation, redlining, urban renewal, deindustrialization, planned shrinkage/catastrophic disinvestment, [and] HOPE VI,” and which began with the theft of this land, Huichin, from the Ohlone people (Development Without Displacement: Resisting Gentrification in the Bay Area. 2014. Causa Justa:: Just Cause, p. 47). Other marginalized communities also face displacement.

Understanding the policies that drive displacement is central to ending it. We hope to educate audiences about the legacy of colonization, capitalism, and white supremacy that still drive displacement today and to envision a future that re-centralizes humanity over profit.

By encompassing voices from in and out of the tech industry, and centering the voices of community members most impacted by displacement and other violence, PLACE to LAND (an oakland love story) will contribute to the dialogue about how to create a just future for Oakland.

We believe that theater is a unique tool that promotes healing and a platform for visualizing and experimenting with solutions in this time of crisis. By supporting this project, you are not only joining the conversation―you are making this visualization and planning for the future happen.

 

Risks & Challenges

How can a small ensemble of artists, most of whom are not from Oakland, hope to do justice to a topic as enormous as Oakland’s history and future? With the help of our community.

Community interviews were central to our research process for WE GO BOOM!, and for PLACE to LAND (an oakland love story) we will again be going out of the rehearsal room to meet with a diverse cross-section of the Bay to learn their stories, dreams, fears, and solutions relating to the past and future of Oakland. We are talking with folks on the front lines for affordable housing and other key policies, economists, tech workers, long-term residents, self-identified gentrifiers, and more! This play needs many different viewpoints in order to create dialogue. We work from the heart to foster trust with our interview participants and respect their stories by acknowledging that while oppressive systems impact each of us in very different ways, all of our liberation is bound up together.

Furthermore, we are building on our community interview model for PLACE to LAND (an oakland love story) by formally partnering with ACCE to learn what their goals are for Oakland’s future and what an ideal community looks like to their members. This partnership is an experiment in the powerful potential found in close collaboration between artists and activists/organizers: in exchange for our partner's assistance in helping us understand the concrete policy solutions to Oakland’s continuing displacement and inequality crises, we will designate one performance as a partial benefit to ACCE, donating a percentage of our ticket sales directly to their efforts. We hope to uplift their experiences and their voices, and in turn deepen the rigor and impact of our work.

We believe that by centering the stories of the most impacted communities in Oakland, and by building the show with visceral physicality, live music, humor, and audience interaction throughout, we can create a space for audiences desperate to have this conversation in a more rigorous way to gather together, see each other, interact with each other, share stories, exchange ideas, and be empowered to act.


Other Ways You Can Help

We believe in grassroots fundraising―no amount is too small to give―and we also invite you to participate in the creation of this work with other gifts. Please contact us at bonfiremakers@gmail.com if you:

  • Are connected with a community space that would like to host a performance

  • Want to share your story and vision for the future, or your specific knowledge of Oakland’s layered histories of displacement

  • Know someone, something we should consult during the research phase of this project

  • Have time, enthusiasm, or skills you’d love to donate to this project

Please email this campaign to people you think would like to support it. Share this page using the Indiegogo share tools. Shout us out in person and on social media. Help us mobilize a wider network of supporters and creators.


In order to create change, we must see clearly what history has to teach us, understand what is happening now in our communities, and act to break the cycles of oppression that have been ruling in the U.S. since before the founding of this nation. By supporting the creation of this play, you are supporting envisioning collective liberation. What do you want to the future of Oakland to look like?  And are you willing to fight for it?

This partnership is an experiment in the powerful potential found in close collaboration between artists and activists/organizers: in exchange for our partner's assistance in helping us understand the concrete policy solutions to Oakland’s continuing displacement and inequality crises, we will designate one performance as a partial benefit to ACCE, donating a percentage of our ticket sales directly to their efforts. We hope to uplift their experiences and their voices, and in turn deepen the rigor and impact of our work.
We believe that by centering the stories of the most impacted communities in Oakland, and by building the show with visceral physicality, live music, humor, and audience interaction throughout, we can create a space for audiences desperate to have this conversation in a more rigorous way to gather together, see each other, interact with each other, share stories, exchange ideas, and be empowered to act. 

Other Ways You Can Help
We believe in grassroots fundraising―no amount is too small to give―and we also invite you to participate in the creation of this work with other gifts. Please contact us at bonfiremakers@gmail.com if you:

Are connected with a community space that would like to host a performance
Want to share your story and vision for the future, or your specific knowledge of Oakland’s layered histories of displacement
Know someone, something we should consult during the research phase of this project
Have time, enthusiasm, or skills you’d love to donate to this project

Please email this campaign to people you think would like to support it. Share this page using the Indiegogo share tools. Shout us out in person and on social media. Help us mobilize a wider network of supporters and creators.
In order to create change, we must see clearly what history has to teach us, understand what is happening now in our communities, and act to break the cycles of oppression that have been ruling in the U.S. since before the founding of this nation. By supporting the creation of this play, you are supporting envisioning collective liberation. What do you want to the future of Oakland to look like?  And are you willing to fight for it?

story:
Dear Friends, 

Many of you have been a huge part of my creative life and for that I am so grateful.  

There have been so many new beginnings with my move to Los Angeles.  I want you to be a part of it, so I am sharing this special project with you and asking for your help. 


Why R.ED? Why Now? 

My creative voice is multi-dimensional.  I would like to believe that I develop artists not just dancers.  Throughout my career I found that there were few creative outlets for me and my dancers, so I created Rhapsody En Dance  - R.ED.  

R.ED is a movement experience that shatters the boundaries between concert and commercial dance by fusing hip-hop, street jazz and contemporary dance styles.  It is a natural extension of my creative voice. The dancers are my sentences.  The movement I create, is the story. 

The company began in New York City with a small group of gifted dancers who brought my vision to life.  Now, we are embarking on the company's first west coast premiere. 

R.ED is not just about the dance. 

It’s about breaking out of the labels and boxes we find ourselves in, especially in this industry.  What we all face at one time or another in our lives; questions about who we really are, what we have to say and how will we say it.  How will we ultimately be defined and who gets to say so?

We want you to be a part of our journey, our movement.  #GetInspiRED!

Become a part of our R.ED family.  Here is how you can help us?

  • Support R.ED Dance Company with a gift of any amount.  FYI...The $100 perks include two tickets to the performance (May 20 & 22).
  • Tell everyone you support R.ED and they should too!   
  • Share our campaign through social media.   Send link to other dancers, supporters, family and friends and encourage them to give. ADD- Please support Rhapsody James and RED Dance Company.  Help shatter the boundaries between commercial and concert dance. 
  • Stay connected: follow us on Facebook, Twitter & Instagram. 

No gift is to small or too large.  All of the funds  raised by this campaign will go towards a creating an engaging experience for our audiences as well as building an infrastructure for future touring. 

We appreciate you so much for being inspirRED! and joining our movement. 

With love, 

Rhapsody 


R.ED West Coast Premiere 2016 | The Colony Theatre in Burbank I May 20 @ 8pm, May 22 @ 5pm, May 22 @ 7:30pm | Burbank, CA I go to www.rhapsodyendance for tickets and more details. 

_________________________________________________

Rhapsody's Bio

R.ED website

Motivating Excellence - M.E.

story:
"Zapping,3 musicales en 1" es un proyecto cultural que reúne en su edición de estreno a 3 compositores y dramaturgos que han desarrollado en equipo 3 historias; cada una con una duración de 30 minutos en base a una sola temática "Entre ilusiones y realidades". Estas serán presentadas en una sola obra de Teatro Musical donde se une lo clásico y lo popular, lo peruano y lo universal, lo serio y lo cómico. El estreno está previsto para el 15 de Setiembre del 2016 en el Centro Cultural Ricardo Palma. Los equipos han tenido la libertad de realizar diversos estilos obteniendo un solo gran musical que combina Drama, Comedia, y Surrealismo a ritmo de Pop, Rock, Vals y Música Clásica. Donde cada actor representará a 3 personajes. Uno por cada musical. Pueden escuchar partes de la música en el video que presentamos aquí. 
Zapping busca desarrollar el Teatro Musical Original Peruano realizando año tras año una convocatoria abierta para que dramaturgos y compositores en duplas participen enviando una historia de 30 minutos para ser producida en una nueva edición bajo una nueva temática.  Estos textos y composiciones serán evaluados por un jurado especialista, además de que los participantes podrán pasar por talleres y capacitaciones asegurando así la exposición de productos finales de alta calidad artística.

Es importante el desarrollo de nuevas ventanas de exposición y dar oportunidad a artistas que quizá no tienen la posibilidad de pertenecer a compañías o asociaciónes donde puedan exponer sus trabajos. Estamos seguros de que en nuestro país contamos con gran talento. Con la ayuda de todos podremos tener todo lo necesario para presentar una producción de alto nivel y así lograr que este proyecto tenga nuevas ediciones y el apoyo de entidades privadas.

“Zapping, 3 Musicales en 1” which translates to “Zapping, Three Musicals in One”, is a cultural project which meets in its premiere edition 3 composers and 3 playwrights who have developed together three stories; each lasting thirty minutes based on a single theme "Between Dreams and Realities”. 

This project seeks to develop the Teatro Musical Original Peruano (Original Peruvian Musical Theater) performing year after year an open call for playwrights and composers to participate in pairs by sending a story of 30 minutes to be produced in a new edition under a general theme. A specialist jury will evaluate these texts and compositions; in addition, participants will go through training workshops and musical composition exposures to ensure end products of high artistic quality.

It is important to develop new windows of opportunity to show and give artists who may not have the possibility of belonging to companies or associations where they can exhibit their work. We are confident that in our country we have great talents. With the help of everyone we can have everything that is required to present a high-level production and achieve this project to new issues and support of private entities.

El proyecto necesita un total  de $15 600 para la producción del musical. Esta campaña busca recaudar un total de $8000 que serán destinados al equipamiento de sonido e iluminación (alquiler) de la sala de teatro en la que estaremos, además de cubrir gastos de escenografía y vestuario. (4 cambios por cada actor)

Desde luego, tu apoyo en este proyecto será sustentado ante Sunat (entidad que fiscaliza los tributos en Perú). "Zapping - 3 Musicales en 1"  se realiza bajo la razón social de Grupo Vodevil S.R.L  en la que cada ingreso y egreso debe estar registrado. 

Tenemos una lista grande de recompensas para todos aquello que nos apoyen, entre merchandising y entradas a eventos o talleres; ya que Zapping tiene muchos eventos paralelos que hace de este proyecto el inicio de un Nuevo Movimiento Cultural en el Perú.  

Dentro de los talleres que se vienen realizando y se realizarán se encuentran:

- Taller de Composición Musical para Teatro y Teatro Musical - A cargo de Antonio Gervasoni (16 de abril al 

- Taller de Introducción a la Creación de Musicales. - Federico Abrill (por confirmar fecha)

- Taller de Creación de Canciones para Musicales. - Sebastian Abad (Por confirmar fecha)

- Media Beca en escuela vodevil: www.escuelavodevil.com

What we need and what you get The project needs a total of $15,600 for the musical production. This campaign aims to raise a total of $8,000, which will be allocated to sound and lighting (rental) equipment of the theater in which we will also cover expenses such as the scenery and costumes. Your support in this project will be supported to Sunat (an entity that oversees taxes in Peru). “Zapping, Three Musicals in One" is performed under the name of Vaudeville Group S.R.L in which each entry and exit must be registered. We have a large list of rewards for all who support us, including merchandising and tickets to the events and/or workshops, since Zapping has many side events that makes this project the beginning of a New Cultural Movement in Peru. 

Estamos ansiosos por ofrecer una nueva ventana de exposición del trabajo de  artístas (dramaturgos, compositores, actores); en la búsqueda de una oportunidad para todo el talento que posee nuestro país. Perú no cuenta con fondos estatales que apoyen la realización de teatro musical. Con esta primera edición queremos mostrar lo capaces que son nuestros artistas y estamos seguros que con este primer paso empresas privadas a las que ya hemos buscado serán las que se interesarán para apoyar esta iniciativa. Ya contamos con el apoyo de mucha gente que nos ha ofrecido espacios, servicios y algunos productos para que este proyecto pueda estar en una etapa de desarrollo exitosa pero aún nos falta la parte más importante y lo lograremos con tu apoyo. 

Difunde nuestra campaña y que más personas se enteren de este nuevo movimiento teatral. Puedes usar nuestras redes sociales , con eso también nos estás ayudando muchísimo. Y si tienes otra idea para poder ayudarnos a tener fondos escríbenos a contacto@vodevilproducciones.com
FACEBEOOK:   /zappingmusicales
TWITTER: @zappingmusical
INSTAGRAM: @zappingmusicales
YOUTUBE: /zappingmusicales
We are eager to offer a new window of exhibition through the work of artists (playwrights, composers, actors) in search for an opportunity of all the talent our country has. Peru has no state funding to support the realization of musical theater. With this first edition we show how capable our artists are and we are confident that this first step will lead private companies, which we have already sought, to be interested to support this initiative. We already have the support of many people who have offered us the space, services and some products so that this project can be successful in a stage of development, but still we lack the most important part and we will be able to succeed with your support. 
Spread our campaign and more people to become aware of this new theater movement. You can use our social networks and by doing so you are also helping us a lot. And if you have other ideas to help us raise funds, please write us at: contacto@vodevilproducciones.com

FACEBEOOK:   /zappingmusicales

TWITTER: @zappingmusical

INSTAGRAM: @zappingmusicales

YOUTUBE: /zappingmusicales


ELENCO: GABRIEL GIL, NATALIA SALAS, MARTIN VELÁSQUEZ

GABRIEL GIL:

Estudiante del TUC y Artes Escénicas de la PUCP, de la especialidad de teatro. Formación en canto, música, danza y especialización en actuación. Codirección en “Un cuento de cuentos”. Ha Participado en obras como “Bare: Expuestos”, “La chica de la torre de Marfil”, “Carmin: el musical”, “El mago del país de las maravillas”, “ClimaX!”, “Un Cuaderno azúl”, “La maldición en la casa de Atreo”, entre otras. Series de televisión como “Al fondo hay sitio”, “Comando Alfa”, “Solamente Milagros”, “Tu decides”, “Amor de madre” etc. Películas como “A los 40”, “365” y “Como en el cine”. Actualmente en nueva serie por estrenar “Amor Valiente”, profesor de actuación en la escuela integral de Shantall Young “Armonika”, montajes teatrales como “Santísima Muerte”, “Cualquiera” en el teatro La Plaza, participado en “Crónicas en Un bar”, entre otras. 

NATALIA SALAS:

Participó en diversas obras de teatro musical como “Amor sin barreras”, “Chicago”, “El Musical 2015” y “El Chico de Oz” realizadas por Preludio. Además en la obra “te de tías” y en obras te teatro musical infantil como “Maria Julia y el árbol gallinero”. También se ha desempeñado como actriz en obras de teatro dramático, siendo unas de las más importantes “Los Cachorros” de Mario Vargas Llosa y “Piaf” dirigida el año pasado por Joaquin Vargas. En televisión su trabajo ha destacaso en los programas “Rita y Yo” (comedia- América televisión), “Así es la Vida” (comedia-América televisión) y “Al fondo hay sitio”. También protagonizó la miniserie “Graffiti” (telenovela- Frecuencia Latina) al lado de Jesús Neyra y perteneció al elenco de la sitcom “Placeres y tentaciones”. En cine ha particiadp en “El Buen Pedro” y “Poseidas”. Actualmente se encuentra en las grabaciones de la novela “El Regreso de Lucas” (América televisión co-Produccion con Telefe de Argentina) 

MARTÍN VELÁSQUEZ:

Egresado de los Talleres de Formación Actoral de Plan 9, Imprología y Alberto Ísola, ha trabajado en musicales como “1968: Historias en Soul” dirigida por Mateo Chiarella, “Dr. Jekyll & Mr. Hyde” , “Grease, El musical de tu vida” dirigida por Henry Gurmendi, “La Tiendita del Horror” entre otros. También ha participado de los montajes dramáticos “Bang Bang... Estás muerto”, “Aquí en la Tierra” , “Demonios en la Piel” , y “El Señor de las Moscas” de Última Orilla Asoc. Cultural. Además participó del Festival Internacional Galatea 201- Resistencia del Chaco y del VI Festival Internacional de Teatro de Formosa ambos en Argentina. Este año saldrá en televisión con un papel importante en la serie “El regreso de Lucas” una coproducción peruano argentina. 

DIRECTOR: Armando Machuca

Director, comunicador, actor, claun e improvisador. Ha sido alumno del Alberto Ísola y es egresado de las canteras de Pataclaun, donde fue docente durante muchos años. Fue el co-conductor del programa matutino “Entre Tú y Yo”junto a Lorena Caravedo, además fue uno de los protagonistas de la serie “El Santo Convento” (América Televisión), interpretando al “Capitán Coyote”. En teatro, fue parte del elenco de “Historia de un caballo” y “Hamlet” ambas dirigidas por Jorge Chiarella en el 2013, protagonizó “Avenida Q, El Musical”, en donde además del humor característico, resaltó su gran destreza con los títeres y su habilidad para cantar. Desde el 2006 (dirigido en su primera versión por Ricardo Morán) hasta la actualidad ha protagonizado con mucho éxito, el unipersonal de improvisación teatral más visto del Perú “DESARMANDO”. El año pasado dirigió uno de los musicales más comerciales del año “FOREVER YOUNG”. 

COMPOSITORES: ANTONIO GERVASONI, SEBASTIAN ABAD, JOSÉ MIGUEL RIOS

ANTONIO GERVASONI:

Estudió piano con Elke Brunke yy Teresa Quesada. Recibió clases maestras del compositor ruso Vladislav Uspensky (1997-1998) y es egresado del Conservatorio Nacional de Música (2001- 2004) en donde siguió la especialidad de Composición Musical. Es miembro fundador del Círculo de Composición del Perú (Circomper). Recibió el Fellowship Diploma en Composición del London College of Music.Ha sido profesor en el Conservatorio Nacional de Música y Director de la Escuela de Música de la Universidad Peruana de Ciencias Aplicadas - UPC (2009-2013).

Su catálogo incluye obras para coro, música de cámara, música sinfónica, música para teatro y las bandas sonoras de películas peruanas como La Gran Sangre, Dragones destino de fuego, Vidas Paralelas, Tarata entre otras. Su composición para coro A-nir, ganó el Vanguard Premieres Choral Composition Contest 2004. En 2014 fue reconocido como Músico Distinguido y recibió una Mención Especial en el 2014 IBLA Grand Prize, por su obra KOCMOC (Cosmos), para orquesta y coro. En 2015, recibió una Mención Honrosa en el 3er Festival Brasil de Cinema Internacional (FBCI) por la banda sonora de la película peruana “La Amante del Libertador”. 

SEBASTIAN ABAD

Director vocal de talleres montaje de teatro musical en las asociaciones culturales Broadway Perú (6 musicales), Las Máscaras (1 musical) y La Compañía (2 musicales). Arreglista y director vocal del coro Vocal Team, semifinalista en el programa Perú Tiene Talento. Arreglista coral para el espectáculo “Cecilia Bracamonte Sin Cuenta Aniversario”. Profesor de coro en el colegio Pestalozzi. Profesor de teoría musical en la escuela de comedia musical D’art. Director vocal del musical Bare, producido por Teatritos A.C (14 al 31 de agosto). Arreglista coral y director vocal del musical Grease, producido por Primer Nivel Entertainment (20 de setiembre al 30 de noviembre). Actual Profesor de repertorio coral en el Instituto Nacional de Teatro Musical INATEM. Profesor de canto en la escuela de artes escénicas VODEVIL. Actual Profesor de interpretación y canto en la escuela de formación actoral ARANWA. 

JOSÉ MIGUEL RÍOS

Músico, actor y cantante. 

Ha participado en diferentes montajes musicales, cortos cinematográficos y conciertos. Sus trabajos más importantes fueron “Rent” el musical y la asistencia de dirección coral en “Grease” 2014. Actualmente se dedica a la composición para teatro musical y artistas solistas. 

DRAMATURGOS: IVANA PEDRESCHI, MARIO MENDOZA Y FEDERICO ABRILL

IVANA PEDRESCHI

Actriz, cantante y bailarina. Participó en más de 15 montajes de teatro musical, eventos, cortometrajes y vídeoclips. Entre sus últimos trabajos destacan “Rent” y “Alicia en Frikiland”. Actualmente, estudia la carrera de Psicología en la Universidad de Piura.

MARIO MENDOZA

Licenciado en Dirección Teatral con extensión en Pedagogía de la Universidad de Palermo (Buenos Aires - Argentina). Terminó sus estudios universitarios al presentar el proyecto de graduación “De la carpa al hospital, evolución y posicionamiento del payaso”. Estudió clown y máscara neutra con diversos maestros en Lima y Buenos Aires. Estudio dirección teatral con maestros como Beatriz Gambartes, Eva Halac, Bernardo Cappa, Diego Coran, entre otros. Es egresado de la Fundación Julio Bocca - Ricky Pashkus en Comedia Musical donde se formó en danza, canto y actuación.

FEDERICO ABRILL

Actor, dramaturgo, productor y guionista. Bachiller de Administración de la Universidad de Lima. Formado como actor por Alberto Ísola, David Carrillo, Jorge Chiarella, Mateo Chiarella, Celeste Viale, entre otros. Como dramaturgo ha estudiado con Alonso Alegría, Cesar de María, Gonzalo Rodríguez Risco, Eduardo Adrianzén y Claudia Sacha.

Como escritor, ha escrito las obras “Espacios Vacíos”, basada en una idea de Fito Valles, “Los Regalos” junto a Fernando Castro y la obra corta para niños “Las Hermanas Pynn” junto a Renzo Amado y “¿El gato te comió la lengua” junto a Jimena del Sante para Microteatro Lima - que se estrenarán el 2015 -además de haber escrito para televisión, empresas, activaciones de publicidad y cine. Su primera obra “El Año Que Perdí La Fantasía” fue ganadora del tercer premio de Ponemos Tu Obra En Escena del Teatro Británico y tuvo una lectura dirigida por Pamela Alderson en el marco de la celebración de los 10 años del Teatro Británico.

PRODUCTOR: PEDRO ITURRIA

Comunicador con especialidad en Relaciones Públicas. Se ha formado también en producción audiovisual y fotografía. Inició sus labores teatrales en producción en la USMP para luego fundar junto a Carolina Silva Santisteban la productora Vodevil Producciones. Sus labores en el ámbito cultural son las siguientes: Productor de “Mujeres que Habitan en Mi” de Guillermo Castrillón, Ganador del primer puesto del Concurso Internacional Andino “Comunicación para la Integración” organizado por FELAFACS (Federación Latinoamericana de Facultades de Comunicación Social), Organizador del Primer Seminario de Producción Teatral que hasta la fecha ya tiene 4 Ediciones. Gestor de la campaña de comunicación del IV Festival La Noche de los Cortos, Productor de “El Dolor por Tu Ausencia” de Jaime Nieto, “Bolognesi en Arica” de Alonso Alegría, “Los Veranos Son Cortos” ,“Cristo Light” y “Humo en la Neblina” de Eduardo Adrianzén; “Bajo la Batalla de Miraflores” de Paola Vicente , MACHO, stand up comedy de Juan Francisco Escobar y “Promoción" de Aldo Miyashiro.

The project needs a total of $15,600 for the musical production.
This campaign aims to raise a total of $8,000, which will be allocated to sound and lighting (rental) equipment of the theater in which we will also cover expenses such as the scenery and costumes.

Your support in this project will be supported to Sunat (an entity that oversees taxes in Peru). “Zapping, Three Musicals in One" is performed under the name of Vaudeville Group S.R.L in which each entry and exit must be registered.

We have a large list of rewards for all who support us, including merchandising and tickets to the events and/or workshops, since Zapping has many side events that makes this project the beginning of a New Cultural Movement in Peru. 


Estamos ansiosos por ofrecer una nueva ventana de exposición del trabajo de  artístas (dramaturgos, compositores, actores); en la búsqueda de una oportunidad para todo el talento que posee nuestro país. Perú no cuenta con fondos estatales que apoyen la realización de teatro musical. Con esta primera edición queremos mostrar lo capaces que son nuestros artistas y estamos seguros que con este primer paso empresas privadas a las que ya hemos buscado serán las que se interesarán para apoyar esta iniciativa. Ya contamos con el apoyo de mucha gente que nos ha ofrecido espacios, servicios y algunos productos para que este proyecto pueda estar en una etapa de desarrollo exitosa pero aún nos falta la parte más importante y lo lograremos con tu apoyo. 

Difunde nuestra campaña y que más personas se enteren de este nuevo movimiento teatral. Puedes usar nuestras redes sociales , con eso también nos estás ayudando muchísimo. Y si tienes otra idea para poder ayudarnos a tener fondos escríbenos a contacto@vodevilproducciones.comFACEBEOOK:   /zappingmusicalesTWITTER: @zappingmusicalINSTAGRAM: @zappingmusicalesYOUTUBE: /zappingmusicalesWe are eager to offer a new window of exhibition through the work of artists (playwrights, composers, actors) in search for an opportunity of all the talent our country has. Peru has no state funding to support the realization of musical theater. With this first edition we show how capable our artists are and we are confident that this first step will lead private companies, which we have already sought, to be interested to support this initiative. We already have the support of many people who have offered us the space, services and some products so that this project can be successful in a stage of development, but still we lack the most important part and we will be able to succeed with your support. 
Spread our campaign and more people to become aware of this new theater movement. You can use our social networks and by doing so you are also helping us a lot. And if you have other ideas to help us raise funds, please write us at: contacto@vodevilproducciones.com

FACEBEOOK:   /zappingmusicales
TWITTER: @zappingmusical
INSTAGRAM: @zappingmusicales
YOUTUBE: /zappingmusicales



ELENCO: GABRIEL GIL, NATALIA SALAS, MARTIN VELÁSQUEZ








GABRIEL GIL:
Estudiante del TUC y Artes Escénicas de la PUCP, de la especialidad
de teatro. Formación en canto, música, danza y especialización en
actuación. Codirección en “Un cuento de cuentos”. Ha Participado en obras como “Bare: Expuestos”, “La chica de la torre
de Marfil”, “Carmin: el musical”, “El mago del país de las maravillas”,
“ClimaX!”, “Un Cuaderno azúl”, “La maldición en la casa de Atreo”, entre
otras. Series de televisión como “Al fondo hay sitio”, “Comando Alfa”,
“Solamente Milagros”, “Tu decides”, “Amor de madre” etc. Películas
como “A los 40”, “365” y “Como en el cine”. Actualmente en nueva
serie por estrenar “Amor Valiente”, profesor de actuación en la escuela
integral de Shantall Young “Armonika”, montajes teatrales como
“Santísima Muerte”, “Cualquiera” en el teatro La Plaza, participado en
“Crónicas en Un bar”, entre otras. 
NATALIA SALAS:







Participó en diversas obras de teatro musical como “Amor sin barreras”,
“Chicago”, “El Musical 2015” y “El Chico de Oz” realizadas por Preludio.
Además en la obra “te de tías” y en obras te teatro musical infantil como
“Maria Julia y el árbol gallinero”. También se ha desempeñado como
actriz en obras de teatro dramático, siendo unas de las más importantes
“Los Cachorros” de Mario Vargas Llosa y “Piaf” dirigida el año pasado por
Joaquin Vargas. En televisión su trabajo ha destacaso en los programas “Rita y Yo” (comedia-
América televisión), “Así es la Vida” (comedia-América televisión) y “Al
fondo hay sitio”. También protagonizó la miniserie “Graffiti” (telenovela-
Frecuencia Latina) al lado de Jesús Neyra y perteneció al elenco de la
sitcom “Placeres y tentaciones”. En cine ha particiadp en “El Buen Pedro”
y “Poseidas”. Actualmente se encuentra en las grabaciones de la novela
“El Regreso de Lucas” (América televisión co-Produccion con Telefe de
Argentina) 
MARTÍN VELÁSQUEZ:







Egresado de los Talleres de Formación Actoral de Plan 9, Imprología y
Alberto Ísola, ha trabajado en musicales como “1968: Historias en Soul”
dirigida por Mateo Chiarella, “Dr. Jekyll & Mr. Hyde” , “Grease, El musical
de tu vida” dirigida por Henry Gurmendi, “La Tiendita del Horror” entre
otros. También ha participado de los montajes dramáticos “Bang Bang... Estás muerto”, “Aquí en la Tierra” , “Demonios en la Piel” ,
y “El Señor de las Moscas” de Última Orilla Asoc. Cultural. Además participó del Festival Internacional Galatea 201- Resistencia del
Chaco y del VI Festival Internacional de Teatro de Formosa ambos en
Argentina. Este año saldrá en televisión con un papel importante en la serie “El
regreso de Lucas” una coproducción peruano argentina. 
DIRECTOR: Armando Machuca









Director, comunicador, actor, claun e improvisador. Ha sido alumno
del Alberto Ísola y es egresado de las canteras de Pataclaun, donde
fue docente durante muchos años. Fue el co-conductor del programa
matutino “Entre Tú y Yo”junto a Lorena Caravedo, además fue uno
de los protagonistas de la serie “El Santo Convento” (América
Televisión), interpretando al “Capitán Coyote”. En teatro, fue parte
del elenco de “Historia de un caballo” y “Hamlet” ambas dirigidas
por Jorge Chiarella en el 2013, protagonizó “Avenida Q, El Musical”,
en donde además del humor característico, resaltó su gran destreza
con los títeres y su habilidad para cantar. Desde el 2006 (dirigido
en su primera versión por Ricardo Morán) hasta la actualidad ha
protagonizado con mucho éxito, el unipersonal de improvisación
teatral más visto del Perú “DESARMANDO”. El año pasado dirigió
uno de los musicales más comerciales del año “FOREVER YOUNG”. 
COMPOSITORES: ANTONIO GERVASONI, SEBASTIAN ABAD, JOSÉ MIGUEL RIOS













ANTONIO GERVASONI:
Estudió piano con Elke Brunke yy Teresa Quesada.
Recibió clases maestras del compositor ruso
Vladislav Uspensky (1997-1998) y es egresado
del Conservatorio Nacional de Música (2001-
2004) en donde siguió la especialidad de
Composición Musical. Es miembro fundador del
Círculo de Composición del Perú (Circomper).
Recibió el Fellowship Diploma en Composición
del London College of Music.Ha sido profesor en
el Conservatorio Nacional de Música y Director de
la Escuela de Música de la Universidad Peruana
de Ciencias Aplicadas - UPC (2009-2013).






Su catálogo incluye obras para coro, música de
cámara, música sinfónica, música para teatro
y las bandas sonoras de películas peruanas
como La Gran Sangre, Dragones destino de
fuego, Vidas Paralelas, Tarata entre otras. Su
composición para coro A-nir, ganó el Vanguard
Premieres Choral Composition Contest 2004. En
2014 fue reconocido como Músico Distinguido
y recibió una Mención Especial en el 2014 IBLA
Grand Prize, por su obra KOCMOC (Cosmos), para
orquesta y coro. En 2015, recibió una Mención
Honrosa en el 3er Festival Brasil de Cinema
Internacional (FBCI) por la banda sonora de la
película peruana “La Amante del Libertador”. 




SEBASTIAN ABAD






Director vocal de talleres montaje de teatro
musical en las asociaciones culturales Broadway
Perú (6 musicales), Las Máscaras (1 musical) y
La Compañía (2 musicales). Arreglista y director
vocal del coro Vocal Team, semifinalista en el
programa Perú Tiene Talento. Arreglista coral para
el espectáculo “Cecilia Bracamonte Sin Cuenta
Aniversario”. Profesor de coro en el colegio
Pestalozzi. Profesor de teoría musical en la
escuela de comedia musical D’art. Director vocal
del musical Bare, producido por Teatritos A.C
(14 al 31 de agosto). Arreglista coral y director
vocal del musical Grease, producido por Primer
Nivel Entertainment (20 de setiembre al 30 de
noviembre). Actual Profesor de repertorio coral
en el Instituto Nacional de Teatro Musical INATEM.
Profesor de canto en la escuela de artes escénicas
VODEVIL. Actual Profesor de interpretación y
canto en la escuela de formación actoral ARANWA. 



JOSÉ MIGUEL RÍOS





Músico, actor y cantante. 
Ha participado
en diferentes montajes musicales, cortos
cinematográficos y conciertos. Sus trabajos
más importantes fueron “Rent” el musical y la
asistencia de dirección coral en “Grease” 2014.
Actualmente se dedica a la composición para
teatro musical y artistas solistas. 
DRAMATURGOS: IVANA PEDRESCHI, MARIO MENDOZA Y FEDERICO ABRILL













IVANA PEDRESCHI
Actriz, cantante y bailarina. Participó en más
de 15 montajes de teatro musical, eventos,
cortometrajes y vídeoclips. Entre sus últimos
trabajos destacan “Rent” y “Alicia en Frikiland”.
Actualmente, estudia la carrera de Psicología en
la Universidad de Piura.








MARIO MENDOZA
Licenciado en Dirección Teatral con extensión
en Pedagogía de la Universidad de Palermo
(Buenos Aires - Argentina). Terminó sus estudios
universitarios al presentar el proyecto de
graduación “De la carpa al hospital, evolución
y posicionamiento del payaso”. Estudió clown y
máscara neutra con diversos maestros en Lima
y Buenos Aires. Estudio dirección teatral con
maestros como Beatriz Gambartes, Eva Halac,
Bernardo Cappa, Diego Coran, entre otros. Es
egresado de la Fundación Julio Bocca - Ricky
Pashkus en Comedia Musical donde se formó en
danza, canto y actuación.








FEDERICO ABRILL
Actor, dramaturgo, productor y guionista.
Bachiller de Administración de la Universidad
de Lima. Formado como actor por Alberto Ísola,
David Carrillo, Jorge Chiarella, Mateo Chiarella,
Celeste Viale, entre otros. Como dramaturgo ha
estudiado con Alonso Alegría, Cesar de María,
Gonzalo Rodríguez Risco, Eduardo Adrianzén y
Claudia Sacha.

Como escritor, ha escrito las obras “Espacios
Vacíos”, basada en una idea de Fito Valles, “Los
Regalos” junto a Fernando Castro y la obra corta
para niños “Las Hermanas Pynn” junto a Renzo
Amado y “¿El gato te comió la lengua” junto a
Jimena del Sante para Microteatro Lima - que se
estrenarán el 2015 -además de haber escrito para
televisión, empresas, activaciones de publicidad
y cine. Su primera obra “El Año Que Perdí La
Fantasía” fue ganadora del tercer premio de
Ponemos Tu Obra En Escena del Teatro Británico
y tuvo una lectura dirigida por Pamela Alderson
en el marco de la celebración de los 10 años del
Teatro Británico.





PRODUCTOR: PEDRO ITURRIA












Comunicador con especialidad en Relaciones Públicas. Se ha formado
también en producción audiovisual y fotografía. Inició sus labores
teatrales en producción en la USMP para luego fundar junto a Carolina
Silva Santisteban la productora Vodevil Producciones. Sus labores en el ámbito cultural son las siguientes: Productor de
“Mujeres que Habitan en Mi” de Guillermo Castrillón, Ganador del primer puesto del Concurso Internacional Andino “Comunicación para la Integración”
organizado por FELAFACS (Federación Latinoamericana de Facultades
de Comunicación Social), Organizador del Primer Seminario de
Producción Teatral que hasta la fecha ya tiene 4 Ediciones. Gestor de
la campaña de comunicación del IV Festival La Noche de los Cortos,
Productor de “El Dolor por Tu Ausencia” de Jaime Nieto, “Bolognesi
en Arica” de Alonso Alegría, “Los Veranos Son Cortos” ,“Cristo Light”
y “Humo en la Neblina” de Eduardo Adrianzén; “Bajo la Batalla de
Miraflores” de Paola Vicente , MACHO, stand up comedy de Juan
Francisco Escobar y “Promoción" de Aldo Miyashiro.

story:
Alexandra Dominguez

My name is Alex Dominguez. I am will be graduating from Concordia University Irvine May of this year with my B.A. in Theatre.  In my 4 years here I have participated in several theatre productions and The Concordia Choir.  I am also the co-founder of the Musical Theatre Company "StageDoor 141" at my University.  I currently work for two different studios teaching Musical Theatre.  Musical Theatre is my passion and  my ultimate goal is to move to New York and perform on Broadway.  I am so thankful for the opportunity to have been accepted into The Open Jar Institute I can not wait to go to the Big Apple!! 

The Open Jar Institute is...
New York City's most Broadway-integrated actor training program. The Open Jar Institute provides select students intensive one-on-one training with some of Broadway's biggest stars, performers, directors, choreographers, agents and casting directors.
A select group of students are chosen each year to spend ONE WEEK in New York City working in intensive master classes, workshops and classes with Broadway's best professionals.
Plus... take backstage tours and meet the cast of Broadway's hottest shows, all in preparation for our own journey to Broadway.

For more Info go to: http://www.openjarinstitute.com/index.html

More ways you can help?

Please spread the word to anyone who would be willing to help donate and help an inspiring artist find her dream!

story:
In a nutshell

11.1/Echo Point started from a collection of 10 plays and a prologue written by American playwright and 2010 Pulitzer Prize nominee Rajiv Joseph.

Now, the Drama Stock association (that’s us) is staging a show based on these texts in an abandoned house in Bucharest. We are a team of 30 theatre professionals with decades of experience between us, both on the independent and on the institutional scenes.


The play

About

11 short plays and a prologue form a puzzle that will take the audience on a journey where they will cross different worlds, equally imperfect, yet familiar. As she crosses from one space to another, the spectator barges in on the intimacy of strangers caught in a moment of their rather mundane life, or so it would seem at first glance. 11 short moments highlighted from the simple existence of others, which expose their whole being, effectively tracing the history of their life in the mind of the viewer. 11 brief sequences, where the audience gets to play the part of a voyeur faced with scenes from their own potential lives. These multiple perspectives of everyday existence confront the viewer with the graceful yet tragic beauty of loneliness that marks a life beyond all other things.  As the stories unfold, not without humor and irony, what seemed to be unrelated fragments of strangers’ lives gradually assemble themselves into a whole, a coherent journey of an individual that could be any one of us. 

The text

Rajiv Joseph, the author of the texts, is an American playwright and a 2010 Pulitzer Prize finalist for Bengal Tiger at the Baghdad Zoo. The scenes were originally written by Rajiv for the One-Minute Play Festival in New-York and were presented as a compilation under the name Echo Point during The International Creative Camp for Playwrights from Târgu Mureș, Romania, in 2014. It was then that Sebastian, the director of 11.1, discovered the text while reading it for the public and utterly fell in love with it. Today, we are 30 people involved in the project, and we are driven by its undisputable concrete beauty. 

The concept

11.1 revolves around the concepts of construction and itinerary. Every scene takes place in a different room and as the audience crosses from one space to another, they discover, one by one, the pieces of a puzzle that can differ from on viewer to another. 

The people

There are 30 people involved in this project, among which we count 22 performers, a set designer, a light designer, a sound engineer, the technical stuff and the PR team. 

The dates

The show is set to be performed on the 22nd, 23rd and 24th of May. These first 3 representations are a demo, a way of advertising, meant to kindle public interest in the event. As the performance is itinerant, each representation can allow no more than 11 persons in the audience, so the show is set to have 10 representations per night. Our aim is to continue performing the show in different locations and cities. 

Who are we?

Drama Stock is a recently formed company that unites people driven by their great passion and love for the theater. Having all experienced working in both institutional and underground theatrical environments, our primary purpose is to contribute to the growth of the Romanian independent theater. Our aims are to constantly challenge the audience with the novelty and creativity of our projects and consolidate a platform which can allow young artists to express and develop themselves artistically and professionally. 

Despite its rather large production costs, we chose 11.1 to be our first project within Drama Stock, as we feel it best illustrates both our artistic policy and our objectives for the future. The project gathers under its creative umbrella artists with different backgrounds, allowing them to share their experiences, while trying to create not only a new performance for the audience, but a truly out of the ordinary experience. 

How will the money be used?

All of the people involved in the project are professionals working in theaters all over the country that have invested time, expertise and creativity into this project, fueled simply by their passion. However, we are committed to paying all of the artistic team, as well as our technical staff for the representations of the show, as we are firm believers that the hard work of the people involved has to be rewarded financially, at least as an objective token of the value they bring to the artistic endeavor. 

As for the venue, ideally we are looking to intertwine our event with an effort to revive abandoned industrial spaces or houses which are testified to be historical monuments. Bucharest, as well as many other cities in Romania, has a lot of buildings such as these, for which small groups of architects or artists are running campaigns in order to promote their transformation into cultural spaces. Our team strongly supports this, and would like to be a part of the process. We are currently evaluating all our options, and will soon choose the venue for our first representations. Updates will be posted here as soon as possible.

The money we are raising is going to be used for: 

-Constructing sets 

-Purchasing costumes 

-Printing and distributing marketing materials

-Compensating the artists and technical staff involved in the project

-Renting the rehearsal and performance venue

-Renting the sound and lighting equipment 

We will publish an overview of every dollar spent on this production at the end of the run, on our website (www.dramastock.ro). To show our appreciation for your generosity, we will be offering some great perks, including show tickets, original posters signed by the cast, digital copies of our making of feature, which will reveal intimate behind-the-scenes moments about the show, and many more. 

Why support us?

Our team strives to show that independent theater can be possible without succumbing to compromise, and that it can provide an ethical working environment for the people involved. Our artistic policy is to present the audience with original performances whose construction and/or subject differs from what is expected from a typical theater play. 

11.1 doesn’t need a target audience. It is meant to speak to anyone in a certain manner, because it tells stories which could be about any one of us at certain points in our lives. The play is not meant to shock or to brutally interfere in the viewer’s life, but to raise questions about the relevance of everyday moments which we pass by, without a second thought. The full construct is a story focused not on the beauty, sadness or tragedy of those moments, but on their ultimate relevance in the whole equation of one’s life. 

What’s next?

We plan to perform the play in other locations around the country, always promoting an architectural monument in need of revival. It is our way of making people aware both of the importance of their history, as well as the need of transforming abandoned buildings into public spaces that can act as nuclei for communities, through art.

At some point, we would also love to be able to transform the making of feature we are recording, into a full-fledged film, as we find it to be an interesting point of departure for analyzing the blurred lines between theater and cinema. The „making of” DVD will also provide insight into designing and completing site-specific theater, which is an often-coveted and all-too-rarely approached form of performance art. We intend to make our DVD as a helpful tool for artists and critics alike.

Of course, our ultimate goal is to bring the show to as many breathtaking spaces as possible, throughout Europe. The underlying premise, the lifeblood, if you will, of our project, is the idea that universal epiphanies come from otherwise banal circumstances. This is a boundless concept, and we are hoping to reach a boundless, global audience.

Other ways you can help

Spreading the word is just as great as money! If you cannot donate, please share this campaign with your friends and family and show us your online support on facebook or tweeter. You will have our friendship and appreciation until the end of time. 

The team

Director: Sebastian Marina

Set designer & costumes: Cristina Milea

Choreographer: Andreea Duță

Music: Eugen Nuțescu (Kumm)

Production Manager: Maria Chirilă & Cătălin Mareș 

PR: Mircea Laslo

Light designer: Lucian Moga

Sound engineer: Gabriel Gheorghe

Assistant: Bianca Stânea

Cast: Oana Rusu, Ionuț Oprea, Radu Câmpean, Claudia Ardelean, Diana Grigoroșcuță, Bogdan Nechifor, Dan Clucinschi, Loredana Topciu, Ion Fiscuteanu Jr, Ana Covalciuc, Adrian Anghel, Elisabeta Râmboi, Cătălin Mareș, Ioana Farcaș, Sebastian Marina, Andreea Duță, Raluca Felezeu, Răzvan Corneci, Daria Moraru, Vlad Unguru

Translation copyrights for the plays: University of Arts, Târgu-Mureș, Romania
